Familiar.FlavourText: It is recommended to stay as far from these hostile creatures as possible -with the exception of plague dragons, who have a natural immunity to serpenta venom.
Familiar.Name: Acid-Tongue Serpenta

Familiar.FlavourText: These observers cluster around ancient aquatic ruins. They may change color to blend with their surroundings.
Familiar.Name: Abyss Striker

Familiar.FlavourText: While they appear non-threatening, dragons take care not to let this spectral creature pass through them.
Familiar.Name: Aer Phantom

Familiar.FlavourText: A backwards thinking creature.
Familiar.Name: Agol

Familiar.FlavourText: A slarg must keep its skin moist to stay hydrated and avoid suffocation.
Familiar.Name: Algae-Bottom Slarg

Familiar.FlavourText: Dwelling in the waters of the Crystal Pools has left the scales of this fish translucent and hard as a gemstone.
Familiar.Name: Almandine Sturgeon

Familiar.FlavourText: The happiest fox.
Familiar.Name: Alstroemeria Fox

Familiar.FlavourText: This distinctive moth has deep reds and purples running through its leafy wings. It's difficult to classify as purely flora or fauna.
Familiar.Name: Amaranth Moth

Familiar.FlavourText: Sometimes dragon eats fish. Sometimes fish eats dragon.
Familiar.Name: Amber Gulper

Familiar.FlavourText: These avians are always humming. It's incredibly annoying.
Familiar.Name: Amberwing Waveskimmer

Familiar.FlavourText: Warped by unstable energies, these arcane-infused ursidae lose all sense of reason when angered.
Familiar.Name: Amethyst King

Familiar.FlavourText: The constant electrical charge that permeates the warm air of the arid savanna acts as an energy boost to this already spry creature. Catching one is extremely difficult.
Familiar.Name: Ampelope

Familiar.FlavourText: The most crotchety of fungi. As it ages the outer shell becomes crackled and hard as stone.
Familiar.Name: Ancient Fungus

Familiar.FlavourText: A blessing and a curse, donning this armor will increase one's martial abilities, but also one's taste for battle.
Familiar.Name: Animated Armor

Familiar.FlavourText: This peculiar statue wasn't standing there when you last looked, and it certainly wasn't posed in that way either. Don't turn your back. Don't look away.
Familiar.Name: Animated Statue

Familiar.FlavourText: Nekomata sleep with their eye open. It's as disconcerting as it sounds.
Familiar.Name: Anomalous Nekomata

Familiar.FlavourText: Two heads are better than one, except when they're connected to two stomachs. Food fight!
Familiar.Name: Anomalous Skink

Familiar.FlavourText: Ewwww... gross! Yuck! The upholstery is definitely the wrong color.
Familiar.Name: Antique Chair

Familiar.FlavourText: Feasting a diet of crystal-scaled fish has had a dramatic effect on the plumage of this crane.
Familiar.Name: Apatite Fisher

Familiar.FlavourText: Entourage of the Arcanist. (Starfall Celebration Holiday Familiar 2013.)
Familiar.Name: Arcane Sprite

Familiar.FlavourText: This Hippalectryon emits a frigid aura.
Familiar.Name: Arctic Hippalectryon

Familiar.FlavourText: Thousands of years of evolution have granted this bat hardened armor to protect against falling magmatic debris.
Familiar.Name: Armored Duskflapper

Familiar.FlavourText: It is arguable whether the armor makes the owl more or less deadly. Without the armor their flight is nearly silent.
Familiar.Name: Armored Greatowl

Familiar.FlavourText: Adapted to filter feed in the scalding depths of Blacksand Annex. (Colored by PythtechGenetics.)
Familiar.Name: Ashen Bicorn Whale

Familiar.FlavourText: This particular variety of chimera only appears in areas of the Starfall Isles where Beastclans are active, leaving some to wonder if the Clans have a hand in their creation.
Familiar.Name: Ashmane Chimera

Familiar.FlavourText: You'd think that, as a serpent, having hooves would be a detriment. You'd be wrong.
Familiar.Name: Ashscale Ophiotaurus

Familiar.FlavourText: A gnarly, vicious land spider that is more at home on the cooled lava than you are. There is definitely reason for concern.
Familiar.Name: Ashspine Widow

Familiar.FlavourText: Dryads will attack dragons that attempt to cut or harvest any piece of their grove.
Familiar.Name: Aspen Gall Dryad

Familiar.FlavourText: Keeping an Augite creation in good working order involves semi-regular patching and allowing the creature long stretches of slumber.
Familiar.Name: Augite Protector

Familiar.FlavourText: The autumn dryad is often seen guiding local fauna to burrows or caves so that they are protected from the approaching colds of winter.
Familiar.Name: Autumn Dryad

Familiar.FlavourText: This variety of pangolin is known for a vibrant shift of color, each unique to the individual. (Colored by biskitten.)
Familiar.Name: Aurora Pangolin

Familiar.FlavourText: This shiny arthropod is a deft swimmer; it is quite a treat to see one swirling and twirling down a creek during the waning sunlight of autumn.
Familiar.Name: Autumn Millifae

Familiar.FlavourText: These creatures will conceal themselves among sea grasses, adding a touch of autumn color to underwater fields of green.
Familiar.Name: Autumn Sea Dragon

Familiar.FlavourText: Sure, 'collector's item' you might say. Might we suggest an axe that doesn't have teeth and eyeballs?
Familiar.Name: Axe Mimic

Familiar.FlavourText: Baku are able to walk both the physical and ethereal plane.
Familiar.Name: Baku

Familiar.FlavourText: A delightful, enchanted Bogsneak marionette. No strings attached!
Familiar.Name: Ball-Jointed Bogsneak

Familiar.FlavourText: Little is known about how the Bamboo Phytocat's physiology evolved, but one thing is for certain: watch the reeds as you walk.. (KS-sponsored by kiohl.)
Familiar.Name: Bamboo Phytocat

Familiar.FlavourText: The banded owlcat moves silently, both in the air and on the ground.
Familiar.Name: Banded Owlcat

Familiar.FlavourText: These animated guardians grow from fallen trees.
Familiar.Name: Barkback Boar

Familiar.FlavourText: Always thrilled to play, this bright canine is the perfect distraction for a lair full of tireless hatchlings. (Colored by Cynderbark.)
Familiar.Name: Barking Jester

Familiar.FlavourText: It's not unheard of for dryads to form alliances with nature dragon clans.
Familiar.Name: Barkskin Watcher

Familiar.FlavourText: A creature with a natural sense of humor, it's not uncommon to see a few Barred Skira trying to blend into a Rambra herd.
Familiar.Name: Barred Skira

Familiar.FlavourText: This springy lizard uses its powerful legs and the reliable burst of hot air from magma vents to quickly traverse lava floes.
Familiar.Name: Basalt Vent Hop

Familiar.FlavourText: A basilisk's gaze can petrify even the hardiest Earth dragons into stone. Staring contests with this familiar are not recommended.
Familiar.Name: Basilisk

Familiar.FlavourText: Never surrender. Never shave. (Colored by Akitaxzero.)
Familiar.Name: Bearded Yeti

Familiar.FlavourText: This species of fish is known for its ability to rapidly change color. Rather than blend in, they seek to intimidate and infatuate their target.
Familiar.Name: Bellus Glamourtail

Familiar.FlavourText: A mix of many rare animals. It can interbreed successfully with species that compose its makeup.
Familiar.Name: Bengal Chimera

Familiar.FlavourText: This dwarf unicorn has lost its magic. Its once shining coat is dull and blackened. The horns of black unicorns are worthless.
Familiar.Name: Black Dwarf Unicorn

Familiar.FlavourText: Forged to infiltrate and dismantle coppercoil creepers. These assassins will perform their work only as long as the coal in their internal furnace burns.
Familiar.Name: Black Iron Creeper

Familiar.FlavourText: A number of Winter Wolves never lose their summer colors. These individuals are uncommon and generally smaller than their snowy-coated brethren.
Familiar.Name: Black Wolf

Familiar.FlavourText: Blackwings are one of the largest species of hummingbird. When in flight, their wings make a distinctive buzzing sound.
Familiar.Name: Black-wing Hummingbird

Familiar.FlavourText: Known for migrating to the warm waters off the coast of Blacksand Annex, Blackline Bicorns compete with the native Ashen Bicorn whales for food. (Colored by Slashfiend.)
Familiar.Name: Blackline Bicorn Whale

Familiar.FlavourText: Raptorik warriors make up for their lack of size with an abundance of ferocity.
Familiar.Name: Blacktalon Striker

Familiar.FlavourText: These creatures spend their early lives swimming in shallow riverbeds. When they mature their fins will have elongated enough to facilitate flight.
Familiar.Name: Blackwing Croaker

Familiar.FlavourText: The eyes of the Flamecaller. (Flameforger's Festival Holiday Familiar 2016.)
Familiar.Name: Blazing Goblin

Familiar.FlavourText: A creature of uncommon tenacity. It collects blight for its patron.
Familiar.Name: Blight Nymph

Familiar.FlavourText: This iridescent beauty becomes even more colorful once it takes flight.
Familiar.Name: Bloodstone Beetle

Familiar.FlavourText: A strangler in bloom is at the end of its life cycle. It is ready to reproduce.
Familiar.Name: Blooming Strangler

Familiar.FlavourText: Where the common Quetzeel is found primarily in the deep seas, the Blotched Quetzeel has strangely made its home in marshes, bogs, and lagoons. Watch where you step!
Familiar.Name: Blotched Quetzeel

Familiar.FlavourText: This cannibalistic snail produces a powerful venom.
Familiar.Name: Blue Dragon Reef Snail

Familiar.FlavourText: Regarded as a top-tier predator of land, sea, and sky, blue tang hippogriffs are at home in any environment.
Familiar.Name: Blue Tang Hippogriff

Familiar.FlavourText: These flowers fend for themselves, uprooting to seek sunlight, shade, and water as required.
Familiar.Name: Blue Vein Pansy

Familiar.FlavourText: Though Serthis are dangerous enough with their unmatched cunning and lightning fast reflexes, they're even more deadly with the right weaponry.
Familiar.Name: Blueband Duelist

Familiar.FlavourText: The bluefin charger hunts on thin ice. It will charge its prey, breaking the ice beneath their feet, sending it to a watery grave. The charger itself is semi-aquatic.
Familiar.Name: Bluefin Charger

Familiar.FlavourText: The static cling is so strong that dragons wearing apparel may end up with several chipskinks affixed to their clothing after wandering through dense brush.
Familiar.Name: Bluelight Chipskink

Familiar.FlavourText: Aviar possess complex vocal chords, enabling them to perfectly mimic the calls of local predators and prey. (KS-sponsored by ZeSethis.)
Familiar.Name: Bluemoon Aviar

Familiar.FlavourText: Salt is the bane of Greatshells; they are only able to survive in fresh water.
Familiar.Name: Blueridge Greatshell

Familiar.FlavourText: Believe it or not, the tint of this mammal's tail is not natural. Bluetail Skira spend much of their day lounging halfway into ponds and lakes where blue algae likes to mingle with their fur.
Familiar.Name: Bluetail Skira

Familiar.FlavourText: A magicked Bogsneak doll that grows an elongated snout in the presence of liars and tricksters.
Familiar.Name: Bogsneak Puppet

Familiar.FlavourText: There's something disconcerting about this bear...
Familiar.Name: Bogus Manamonger

Familiar.FlavourText: Although frightening to look at, bone fiends mostly keep to themselves and the piles of calcified remains that they have collected.
Familiar.Name: Bone Fiend

Familiar.FlavourText: . .. .mysql expects parameter 1 to be string, boolean given. .. (Flight Rising Beta Tester gift)
Familiar.Name: Boolean

Familiar.FlavourText: A favored mount of sprangyroo mercenaries.
Familiar.Name: Boran Veteran

Familiar.FlavourText: A creature of uncommon strength. It collects boulders for its patron.
Familiar.Name: Boulder Nymph

Familiar.FlavourText: A colony of bramble guardians is sure to keep any lair warded from tiny intruders.
Familiar.Name: Bramble Guardian

Familiar.FlavourText: It's not uncommon for these rambunctious canines to get completely distracted by their own beautiful wings. Snap out of it, boy! (Colored by Solarstar.)
Familiar.Name: Brightwing Dwarf Hainu

Familiar.FlavourText: Naturally gifted with a photographic memory and a phosphorescent mane. (KS-Sponsored by Mythka.)
Familiar.Name: Brilliant Psywurm

Familiar.FlavourText: A fastidious and precise familiar. The brown river flight is not capable of true flight, but its powerful wings propel it through the water at great speeds.
Familiar.Name: Brown River Flight

Familiar.FlavourText: These otherwise passive insectoids become enraged if you pick their flowers.
Familiar.Name: Brown-Spotted Mith

Familiar.FlavourText: Brush dodos will stand perfectly still when they encounter a dragon; this remarkable adaptation will ensure the survival of the species.
Familiar.Name: Brush Dodo

Familiar.FlavourText: A lovely little lilypad... that moves... and eats things that land on it... lovely... (Colored by Kizmetto.)
Familiar.Name: Bubble Brook Gecko

Familiar.FlavourText: A creature of uncommon charm. It collects bubbles for its patron.
Familiar.Name: Bubble Nymph

Familiar.FlavourText: The wings of this mantid never become large enough to facilitate flight.
Familiar.Name: Budwing Morpho

Familiar.FlavourText: Don't tell this cockatrice it missed -and will always miss- leg day. It's plenty buff! (Colored by Whompus.)
Familiar.Name: Buff Laced Cockatrice

Familiar.FlavourText: Buzz buzz, buzz buzz buzz.
Familiar.Name: Bumble

Familiar.FlavourText: This species of caiman got its milky coloration from keeping to dark underground rivers. (Colored by AlpineHell.)
Familiar.Name: Butter Caiman

Familiar.FlavourText: A valuable part of the woodland ecosystem, stranglers will break down organic material rapidly.
Familiar.Name: Buttercup Strangler

Familiar.FlavourText: Hugging this familiar is not the recommended method of bonding.
Familiar.Name: Cactus Marzal

Familiar.FlavourText: A thick, romantic accent and welcoming grin enchant your senses. You feel like a guest here, but can't quite let your guard down.
Familiar.Name: Calculating Candelabra

Familiar.FlavourText: Candy Cockatrice will only develop brilliant colors if fed a steady diet of concentrated sugar. The colorful ones don't live very long... (Colored by Jasp.)
Familiar.Name: Candy Cockatrice

Familiar.FlavourText: Xolo, Xolo, Xolo, Xolo, Xolo, Xolo, Xolo, Xolo, Xolo, Xolo.
Familiar.Name: Candycane Xolo

Familiar.FlavourText: The brilliant plumage of male cardinal hippogriffs is scrutinized by potential mates.
Familiar.Name: Cardinal Hippogriff

Familiar.FlavourText: The carmine serthis' scales present a particularly rich shade of red after it has freshly molted.
Familiar.Name: Carmine Serthis

Familiar.FlavourText: The dreaded carrioncorn is said to stampede in massive herds throughout the Abiding Boneyard, sometimes locked in vicious battles with resident vultures over rare food sources.
Familiar.Name: Carrioncorn

Familiar.FlavourText: Larger than the average mith, ceanothus miths frequently train to act as the vanguard of their fellows.
Familiar.Name: Ceanothus Brawler

Familiar.FlavourText: Resembles a creature of draconic legend from a distance. Up close it merely looks delicious.
Familiar.Name: Celestial Antelope

Familiar.FlavourText: Asking a centaur archer ’What’s your sign?’ is a sure way to put one on your back that reads ’target’.
Familiar.Name: Centaur Archer

Familiar.FlavourText: With a beard like that, you know he means business.
Familiar.Name: Centaur Berserker

Familiar.FlavourText: These crayfish can live for hundreds of years.
Familiar.Name: Chalcedony Snipper

Familiar.FlavourText: Sprangyroo are commonly hired on as mercenaries by the Longneck clan.
Familiar.Name: Charcoal Sprangyroo

Familiar.FlavourText: I want to be shiiiiinnny!
Familiar.Name: Charoite Burrower

Familiar.FlavourText: So the experiment was not exactly a success...but somehow you cannot bring yourself to dump the results. Is... is it smiling at you?
Familiar.Name: Cheerful Residue

Familiar.FlavourText: Well camouflaged for one week a year.
Familiar.Name: Cherry Blossom Caterpillar

Familiar.FlavourText: In one of Sornieth's finest shows of migration, this sect of harpies has moved from the Southern Icefield to the Ashfall Waste and never looked back.
Familiar.Name: Chillwind Harpy

Familiar.FlavourText: A blend of lion, goat, and serpent, the chimera is a dangerous foe. It's giving you a funny look.
Familiar.Name: Chimera

Familiar.FlavourText: No acorn or insect resembling an acorn is safe.
Familiar.Name: Chipskink

Familiar.FlavourText: These little guys get into everything. It's worth the time it takes a dragon to ferret-proof its lair.
Familiar.Name: Chocolate Ferret

Familiar.FlavourText: Step 1: Draft blueprint of robotic guard. Step 2: Revise until prototype is obnoxious and hilarious. Step 3: ??? Step 4: Profit.
Familiar.Name: Chromefeather Lookout

Familiar.FlavourText: An industrial symbiote to clans in the Ashfall Waste, cinder miths can sometimes be found working in tandem with metallurgists and blacksmiths to produce tools and weaponry. (Colored by Craven.)
Familiar.Name: Cinder Mith

Familiar.FlavourText: A creature of uncommon bravery. It collects cinders for its patron.
Familiar.Name: Cinder Nymph

Familiar.FlavourText: A playful loach capable of superheating the water surrounding it for half a meter.
Familiar.Name: Cinderkelp Loach

Familiar.FlavourText: Colonies of these tiny lizards live deep within Dragonhome's cave systems. The glowing fungus they consume contributes to the lizards' bioluminescence.
Familiar.Name: Citrine Cave Jewel

Familiar.FlavourText: These automatons follow and repair the destruction caused by monkey wrench golems.
Familiar.Name: Clattercog Engineer

Familiar.FlavourText: A maren gifted in divination is a rare and treasured member of the school.
Familiar.Name: Clearwater Oracle

Familiar.FlavourText: As it ascends into the heavens, the clicks and whistles it emits can be roughly translated to ’So long and thanks for all the fish.’
Familiar.Name: Cloud Chaser

Familiar.FlavourText: A playful species of raptor named for their hide-and-seek behavior among cloud banks. (KS-sponsored by Vahilor.)
Familiar.Name: Clouddancer

Familiar.FlavourText: A creature of uncommon curiosity. It collects clouds for its patron.
Familiar.Name: Cloud Nymph

Familiar.FlavourText: Up until recent memory, clouded miths were clouded myths. Their numbers have increased a great deal in the last century. (Colored by Hallea.)
Familiar.Name: Clouded Mith

Familiar.FlavourText: Guardian of the Windswept Plateau. (Mistral Jamboree 2015.)
Familiar.Name: Cloudkeeper Herald

Familiar.FlavourText: The clown charger's skin is poisonous. Most dragons consider eating them to be more trouble than hunting them.
Familiar.Name: Clown Charger

Familiar.FlavourText: No more humorous than other equines.
Familiar.Name: Clown Hippocampus

Familiar.FlavourText: A towering yeti with huge meaty fists. Under its gruesome exterior, there's a heart of gold. Or a thousand digested dragon bones...
Familiar.Name: Coarsefur Yeti

Familiar.FlavourText: Don't let the Cockatrice's amusing gait fool you, its screeching crow can freeze a dragon in place.
Familiar.Name: Cockatrice

Familiar.FlavourText: *Rivet Rivet*
Familiar.Name: Cog Frog

Familiar.FlavourText: This buttersnake will shed its wings when startled. (Colored by Grovey.)
Familiar.Name: Colorburst Buttersnake

Familiar.FlavourText: The hidden labyrinthine home of the Serthis is decorated with intricate masonry like this, said to be enchanted with the souls of warriors long past.
Familiar.Name: Colubrid Column

Familiar.FlavourText: The common podid has uncommonly good taste. Or tastes uncommonly good. It really depends on who you ask.
Familiar.Name: Common Podid

Familiar.FlavourText: Trained from a very early age, these young harpy warriors are often far more seasoned in the ways of battle than rival beastclan counterparts.
Familiar.Name: Condorwing Champion

Familiar.FlavourText: The power grips on this suit are capable of matching the bite force of a Snapper.
Familiar.Name: Construction Mith

Familiar.FlavourText: These golems were designed to traverse and perform maintenance on the inaccessible conduits of Tempest Spire.
Familiar.Name: Coppercoil Creeper

Familiar.FlavourText: While unable to turn a dragon to stone, a coral basilisk's steely gaze can hold foolish dragons captive.
Familiar.Name: Coral Basilisk

Familiar.FlavourText: Though most manticores lean on sheer, indomitable strength to get them through tough situations, this one has adopted a much more subdued approach. (Flameforger's Festival 2018 Holiday Item)
Familiar.Name: Conflagrant Ambassador

Familiar.FlavourText: Serthis have an excellent natural protection against poisons and toxins, making them natural emissaries to the Scarred Wasteland.
Familiar.Name: Contaminated Ambassador

Familiar.FlavourText: Long thought to be an extremely rare mutation, two-headed members of this species began outliving their single-headed siblings due to the added benefit of being able to watch for predators in several directions at once.
Familiar.Name: Conjoined Skink

Familiar.FlavourText: This solitary species of bee lives in coastal areas. It is known for burrowing into desiccated pieces of coral.
Familiar.Name: Coral Carpenter

Familiar.FlavourText: An unfortunate creature makes for a fortunate corpse cleaner.
Familiar.Name: Corpse Cleaner

Familiar.FlavourText: Depin native to Fishspine Reef feed almost exclusively on the poisonous species of fish native to area. Their ability to process the poison leaves their food source uncontested.
Familiar.Name: Corrosive Depin

Familiar.FlavourText: These slow, towering plant-eaters carve a predictable route through the savanna, often wearing down a well-trodden dirt path for others of their herd to follow.
Familiar.Name: Coursing Skira

Familiar.FlavourText: This tiny lizard feasts on insects and gemstones. One provides significantly more nutrition than the other.
Familiar.Name: Corundum Chameleon

Familiar.FlavourText: The more luminous specimens consume a great quantity of fireflies. (Colored by LugiaFly.)
Familiar.Name: Cosmo Gecko

Familiar.FlavourText: Guardian of Dragonhome. (Rockbreaker's Ceremony 2014.)
Familiar.Name: Cragbacked Bouldursa

Familiar.FlavourText: Elemental acolyte of the Icewarden. (Crystalline Gala Holiday Item 2016.)
Familiar.Name: Cragward Custodian

Familiar.FlavourText: Your workshop will never be safe again.
Familiar.Name: Crazed Powermith

Familiar.FlavourText: A shy violet that will only move when no one is watching. This is a perfectly normal thing to plant in a garden.
Familiar.Name: Creeping Tendril

Familiar.FlavourText: River Flights prefer to den in water-adjacent caves and tunnels. They've recently begun to infest sewer systems.
Familiar.Name: Crested River Flight

Familiar.FlavourText: Despite its appearance, the Crimson Emperor is not a malignant creature. Its striking coloration is used to ward off predators. (KS-sponsored by Windswept.)
Familiar.Name: Crimson Emperor

Familiar.FlavourText: The shell of this snail is covered in a variety of colorful coral and anemones. In its reef environment this snail is perfectly camouflaged.
Familiar.Name: Crimson Reef Snail

Familiar.FlavourText: The bonepriest's crown grows an additional prong with each successful molt.
Familiar.Name: Crowned Bonepriest

Familiar.FlavourText: One of only a few airborne creatures in Sornieth larger than a dragon.
Familiar.Name: Crowned Roc

Familiar.FlavourText: Don't be fooled, the last thing you want is a weapon that might bicker about which way it's being swung.
Familiar.Name: Crooked Hatchet

Familiar.FlavourText: Both this globe and its fishy patron are likely figments of the imagination.
Familiar.Name: Crystal Carrier

Familiar.FlavourText: Baldwin might nonchalantly refer to this impossible monstrosity as "the one that got away."
Familiar.Name: Curious Kettle

Familiar.FlavourText: The eyes of the Earthshaker. (Rockbreaker's Ceremony Holiday Familiar 2016.)
Familiar.Name: Crumbling Goblin

Familiar.FlavourText: Knock knock! Who's there? Crystalhide Jester! Who? A turtle cannot write or finish a joke.
Familiar.Name: Crystalhide Jester

Familiar.FlavourText: When a crystalplate stinger has fallen, it's recommended to clear the area; its passing will attract and enrage others of its kind.
Familiar.Name: Crystalplate Stinger

Familiar.FlavourText: It's so fluffy!
Familiar.Name: Cumulus Seal

Familiar.FlavourText: What is this bat's curse? That's for the unfortunate soul who catches this one to discover.
Familiar.Name: Cursed Bat

Familiar.FlavourText: Wavehoppers that do not experience a drought during their tadpole phase never metamorphose into an adult that is capable of leaving the water.
Familiar.Name: Dainty Wavehopper

Familiar.FlavourText: You encountered this centaur from the Dunhoof herd while hunting. She decided to stay with your clan to learn your hunting techniques.
Familiar.Name: Dappled Dunhoof

Familiar.FlavourText: It's not wise to catch a chimera by the tail.
Familiar.Name: Darktouched Chimera

Familiar.FlavourText: Elemental acolyte of the Plaguebringer. (Riot of Rot Holiday Item 2015.)
Familiar.Name: Deadland Disciple

Familiar.FlavourText: I always feel like somebody's watching me. Who's playing tricks on me?
Familiar.Name: Deadly Reflection

Familiar.FlavourText: The dappled seal will make short work of the fish that are are attracted by its curly mane.
Familiar.Name: Dappled Seal

Familiar.FlavourText: A terror to any dragon who gardens.
Familiar.Name: Dark-Tufted Sparrowmouse

Familiar.FlavourText: These jovial fish are easy to catch.
Familiar.Name: Daydream Puffer

Familiar.FlavourText: These animated guardians have been mobile for too long and must rest or their foliage will wither and die.
Familiar.Name: Deadwood Boar

Familiar.FlavourText: This murderous bird is blind save for the large, ominous eye on its chest.
Familiar.Name: Death Seeker

Familiar.FlavourText: Some consider it a harbinger of misfortune, but most dismiss such omens as old-wrym's tales. (KS-sponsored by Windswept.)
Familiar.Name: Death's-Head Stag

Familiar.FlavourText: This elusive mammal plunders dragon caves for its insectoid diet. Along the way, it amasses benign colonies of glowing fungus that help provide vision in the darkest passages.
Familiar.Name: Deepmine Aardvark

Familiar.FlavourText: Their impressive collars are used in displays of aggression.
Familiar.Name: Depin

Familiar.FlavourText: Often misunderstood due to its name, the presence of Dire Vultures often means there is plenty of food nearby.
Familiar.Name: Dire Vulture

Familiar.FlavourText: A predator best avoided by all but the largest of dragons, Deeprealm Hunters are capable of diving over six hundred meters deep.
Familiar.Name: Deeprealm Hunter

Familiar.FlavourText: The very last thing you wanted to encounter on a dark night.
Familiar.Name: Disoriented Spirit

Familiar.FlavourText: Rescued from the dinnerplate of a clanmate, this dodo is something special. Or at least you think it is; well, it's your dodo now...
Familiar.Name: Dodo

Familiar.FlavourText: Double-tailed Warcats rival the size of many dragons. These fierce creatures are bred and trained as guardians by the Longneck tribes.
Familiar.Name: Double-Tailed Warcat

Familiar.FlavourText: Dread doesn't even really begin to describe the feeling one should have when this upsetting creature charges.
Familiar.Name: Dreadram

Familiar.FlavourText: Despite its fearsome appearance, having a dream eater visit you in your sleep can be a boon, as it will consume your nightmares.
Familiar.Name: Dreameater

Familiar.FlavourText: Dryads are only seen when spring is approaching, waking from yearlong naps to trim their leafy manes.
Familiar.Name: Dryad

Familiar.FlavourText: The toxins found in the venom of Driftwood Barons have been used to combat the onset of several strains of Wyrmwound plague.
Familiar.Name: Driftwood Baron

Familiar.FlavourText: Though some are kept as pets, downy fox rats are actually a problem for many lairs. They will nest in the walls and spoil a clan's stores.
Familiar.Name: Downy Fox Rat

Familiar.FlavourText: The venom from a Dunewind Manticore sting is potent enough to knock out an imperial dragon for several hours. (Colored by Asmo.)
Familiar.Name: Dunewind Manticore

Familiar.FlavourText: The dunhoof herd of centaurs have been the allies of dragons for years beyond counting. This one is an ambassador to your lair.
Familiar.Name: Dunhoof Ambassador

Familiar.FlavourText: Bonepicker gryphons stockpile bones for later consumption.
Familiar.Name: Duskthicket Bonepicker

Familiar.FlavourText: You can teach this pup everything... except how to mimic speech. (Colored by Sandwich.)
Familiar.Name: Dwarf Hainu Macaw

Familiar.FlavourText: Slight and sleek, this unicorn possesses all of the charm, but less than half the magic and size of a true unicorn.
Familiar.Name: Dwarf Unicorn

Familiar.FlavourText: Entourage of the Earthshaker. (Rockbreakers Ceremony Holiday Familiar 2013.)
Familiar.Name: Earth Sprite

Familiar.FlavourText: Ectoplasmimes are most often found in haunted areas, hiding between crates, vases, and other furniture. We don't recommend storing anything important inside.
Familiar.Name: Ectoplasmime

Familiar.FlavourText: It is not uncommon to see a Dustfeather Sphinx standing completely still. Don't mistake this for stoicism; it can use this unique stance to store energy to aid it in quick and relentless pursuit of
Familiar.Name: Dustfeather Sphinx

Familiar.FlavourText: The most insecure of fungi.
Familiar.Name: Dwarf Truffle

Familiar.FlavourText: Favored mounts and companions to fae dragons, its antlers make an excellent perch.
Familiar.Name: Elk

Familiar.FlavourText: This mouse is no more flammable than any other.
Familiar.Name: Ember Mouse

Familiar.FlavourText: One of the few cave-dwelling creatures to possess functional eyes, Emerald Cave Jewels produce their own light source.
Familiar.Name: Emerald Cave Jewel

Familiar.FlavourText: Warped by arcane energies, this twisted bird bears little resemblance to its parents. All its eyes are looking in different directions.
Familiar.Name: Emerald Webwing

Familiar.FlavourText: Hunters discourage the poaching of these somewhat lazy bears for the emerald-like growths along their hide. Trained, they are excellent lair guardians. (Colored by DirkJake.)
Familiar.Name: Emeraldback Shardspawn

Familiar.FlavourText: It once controlled a vast empire of mites, but now that it has befriended a dragon it has moved on to greater aspirations.
Familiar.Name: Empress Beetle

Familiar.FlavourText: These swans are easily entranced by each other and by reflective surfaces.
Familiar.Name: Enamored Swan

Familiar.FlavourText: A creature of uncommon ingenuity. It harvests electricity for its patron.
Familiar.Name: Electric Nymph

Familiar.FlavourText: The eyes of the Arcanist. (Starfall Celebration Holiday Familiar 2016.)
Familiar.Name: Enchanting Goblin

Familiar.FlavourText: The eyes of the Plaguebringer. (Riot of Rot Holiday Familiar 2016.)
Familiar.Name: Enduring Goblin

Familiar.FlavourText: Full round action: slash, stab, bite!
Familiar.Name: Enchanted Armaments

Familiar.FlavourText: After hours of wrestling, this impressive tome finally comes to rest, lets its pages fly open, and reveals... 300 pages of ways to prepare liver and onions.
Familiar.Name: Ensorcelled Volume

Familiar.FlavourText: These small owls will burrow for gems to adorn themselves with in hopes of attracting mates.
Familiar.Name: Enstatite Burrower

Familiar.FlavourText: Catching a trickster in the midst of its trick is much easier than catching the spirit itself. It vanishes as soon as it's been spotted.
Familiar.Name: Ethereal Trickster

Familiar.FlavourText: Everglade lashers swim in colorful, shining schools. They migrate up rivers to the base of The Behemoth every spring.
Familiar.Name: Everglade Lasher

Familiar.FlavourText: Jackalope ensnare bits of dry debris to burn when they forage in dangerous terrain. After this fuel has burned out, the jackalope is vulnerable to predators.
Familiar.Name: Extinguished Jackalope

Familiar.FlavourText: There's something dubious about this bear...
Familiar.Name: Fallbrush Fraud

Familiar.FlavourText: The coats of fawn fox rats are prized for their softness. Luckily for this one you decided to befriend it!
Familiar.Name: Fawn Fox Rat

Familiar.FlavourText: These deceitful harpies claim to be defectors of Talona, striking out to forge alliances with dragonkind. Little do many know that they are actually her most talented spies.
Familiar.Name: Eye of Talona

Familiar.FlavourText: Flocks of streaks circle above the Arcanist's observatory.
Familiar.Name: Fallout Streak

Familiar.FlavourText: Though most harpies employ fairly cutthroat guerrilla tactics to battle their enemies, these practiced warriors rely on their years of blade training to press an advantage.
Familiar.Name: Falconclaw Warrior

Familiar.FlavourText: The intricate armor worn by streaks is not natural, leading some dragons to wonder who is outfitting these predators.
Familiar.Name: Fallen Streak

Familiar.FlavourText: Arachnids that grow this large ain't right.
Familiar.Name: Fan Scorpion

Familiar.FlavourText: Sewer sludge has wrought changes upon the locals...
Familiar.Name: Fanrat

Familiar.FlavourText: Featherback hunts can quickly turn deadly. These aggressive beasts don't go down without a fight!
Familiar.Name: Featherback Boar

Familiar.FlavourText: Fiendcats are known as one of Sornieth's only feral predatory mammals to cook their food before they eat it. One pounce works to get a good sear going.
Familiar.Name: Fiendcat

Familiar.FlavourText: The chilled webbing emitted by this nasty arachnid is highly flame-retardant. It is not uncommon for weavers to build massive webs above magma vents to catch careless vent-hopping lizards.
Familiar.Name: Firebelly Weaver

Familiar.FlavourText: Grace and ferocity all bundled into one: this fiery feline knows how to battle, and knows how to win.
Familiar.Name: Firemane Manticore

Familiar.FlavourText: Vastly superior to familiars with a lesser footprint.
Familiar.Name: Five-toed Pilco

Familiar.FlavourText: Do not catch a cockatrice's gaze. (Colored by NadopT.)
Familiar.Name: Firefly Cockatrice

Familiar.FlavourText: While it won't start any fires, it is attracted to them, and anything that glows.
Familiar.Name: Firebug

Familiar.FlavourText: Entourage of the Flamecaller. (Flameforger's Festival Holiday Familiar 2013.)
Familiar.Name: Fire Sprite

Familiar.FlavourText: A fiendcat that is ill will produce only smoke.
Familiar.Name: Flamerest Fiendcat

Familiar.FlavourText: The Flamescale clan's mysterious magi draw their power from the powerful tectonic activity of the area, culminating in potent spells.
Familiar.Name: Flamescale Illusionist

Familiar.FlavourText: Though already quick as a whip, these skilled fighters can increase their deadliness by hurling their finely-crafted spears to help close range with their enemies.
Familiar.Name: Flamescale Lancer

Familiar.FlavourText: It's almost impossible to truly incapacitate these grizzled fighters unless you disarm them.
Familiar.Name: Flamescale Spearman

Familiar.FlavourText: If the heat weren't enough, the mix of boiling hot poisons will likely take care of any would-be assailant.
Familiar.Name: Flamescale Venomcaster

Familiar.FlavourText: These imposing carrion birds are actually extremely tender if you're--how do we put this--alive.
Familiar.Name: Flesh Forager

Familiar.FlavourText: As calm and majestic as cerdae look, they must routinely spar to wear down their horns, which grow at an alarmingly fast rate.
Familiar.Name: Flora Cerdae

Familiar.FlavourText: A creature of uncommon shyness. It collects flowers for its patron.
Familiar.Name: Flower Nymph

Familiar.FlavourText: The snore heard 'round the world.
Familiar.Name: Flowering Pohip

Familiar.FlavourText: This automaton has continued to work long after its pilot ran away.
Familiar.Name: Frost Delver

Familiar.FlavourText: Frostbite dryads are rumored to guide cold-afflicted travelers into deep snowbank traps. Watch your step!
Familiar.Name: Frostbite Dryad

Familiar.FlavourText: Though they can thrive in a variety of climates, frosted pocketmice are known for their tenacity during harsh winters.
Familiar.Name: Frosted Pocketmouse

Familiar.FlavourText: The Pukasloth has a pair of webbed wings that are rumored to have once allowed the creature to fly. Nowadays they are vestigial and mostly used for looking adorable.
Familiar.Name: Fluted Pukasloth

Familiar.FlavourText: Frostbite hummingbirds are the messengers of the Icewarden. These tiny beings are minor ice spirits and not living, breathing birds at all.
Familiar.Name: Frostbite Hummingbird

Familiar.FlavourText: The eyes of the Icewarden. (Crystalline Gala Holiday Familiar 2017.)
Familiar.Name: Frozen Goblin

Familiar.FlavourText: The yearly nocturnal festivities aren't always consumed by gloom and doom; this very rare and colorful critter surfaces on the shortest days of the year and returns to its burrows as the days start to lengthen.
Familiar.Name: Flutterbun

Familiar.FlavourText: Fuiran are one of the few species in the Shifting Wastes that prey upon Scalebacks. Their powerful jaws are capable of cracking the thick hide.
Familiar.Name: Fuiran

Familiar.FlavourText: These creatures leave a trail of vibrant fungi in their wake. Tracking a Fungalhoof Qiriq is easy; surviving an encounter with one is less so.
Familiar.Name: Fungalhoof Qiriq

Familiar.FlavourText: Known for its patience and wisdom, its anecdotes are only understood by other fungi.
Familiar.Name: Fungi Sage

Familiar.FlavourText: Gale wolves may appear wherever a warm front meets a cold front. During their brief stay on our plane they leave a whirlwind of destruction in their wake.
Familiar.Name: Gale Wolf

Familiar.FlavourText: Larails are a gardener's nemesis. However, they will try and feed on the shells of their fellows, so populations never grow too large.
Familiar.Name: Garden Larail

Familiar.FlavourText: What kind of a garden do you come from?
Familiar.Name: Garden Watcher

Familiar.FlavourText: This enormous decopod releases millions of tiny bubbles from its carapace to ward off predators. But really, who is afraid of bubbles?
Familiar.Name: Gaseous Megashrimp

Familiar.FlavourText: There's something different about this bear...
Familiar.Name: Fungusbearing Phony

Familiar.FlavourText: This decorated creature uses its barbed tail and powerful wings to fight targets in the air as well as on the ground.
Familiar.Name: Ghost Manticore

Familiar.FlavourText: Neither fanrats nor sewer sludge are responsible for this horror.
Familiar.Name: Ghostly Rat Lord

Familiar.FlavourText: A creature of myth and urban legend! It and its 5,783 cousins are a rare and elusive find.
Familiar.Name: Giant White Toridae

Familiar.FlavourText: Quite possibly the most dangerous part about crossing rivers and streams, this quick reptile is content to snap at ankles and tails. Watch for its bright yellow eyes! (Colored by Zangoose.)
Familiar.Name: Gladeveins Needletooth

Familiar.FlavourText: Glasswings regularly shed their wings. The new growth may be of a different color each time.
Familiar.Name: Glasswing Flutter

Familiar.FlavourText: These diminutive fish live in shallow puddles. They will use their fins to propel them across short stretches of land.
Familiar.Name: Glamourtail Hopper

Familiar.FlavourText: The duskrat is actually a closer cousin to the common mouse than a rat. They are extremely sensitive to light and only come out after dusk.
Familiar.Name: Glossy Duskrat

Familiar.FlavourText: It's really just full of hot air.
Familiar.Name: Glowing Globe

Familiar.FlavourText: The happier it is, the brighter it glows. This one seems to like you.
Familiar.Name: Glowing Pocket Mouse

Familiar.FlavourText: Lionsnakes can use stored up kinetic energy in their spiral-like bodies to launch themselves at unsuspecting prey.
Familiar.Name: Golden Lionsnake

Familiar.FlavourText: The golden porpoise is capable of leaping great distances over the water.
Familiar.Name: Golden Porpoise

Familiar.FlavourText: Dragons who choose to bond gold-throated sparrows as familiars often have a difficult time keeping them out of the bellies of their clan-mates.
Familiar.Name: Gold-Throated Sparrow

Familiar.FlavourText: If you release this familiar, it will grant you a wish.
Familiar.Name: Golden Featherfin

Familiar.FlavourText: A shining gold fox that will only deign to accompany the wealthiest of dragons.
Familiar.Name: Golden Kitsune

Familiar.FlavourText: Once revered by ancient Manticores, this idol makes a really swell door stop for your lair. Bling!
Familiar.Name: Golden Idol

Familiar.FlavourText: Bantam Fangar lines have been bred to produce a smaller, stockier cat. Their soft purr can soothe hatchlings to sleep.
Familiar.Name: Golden Bantam Fangar

Familiar.FlavourText: A methodical grooming may sooth a Goldenbeast where music has proven ineffectual.
Familiar.Name: Goldenbeast

Familiar.FlavourText: This mith wields the elemental energies of the land.
Familiar.Name: Goldenplains Poodle Mith

Familiar.FlavourText: River Flights spend nearly twice as much time playing as hunting, but they spend three times as much time sleeping.
Familiar.Name: Goldfin River Flight

Familiar.FlavourText: The stony tail of the granite thresher can be used as a weapon to stun prey.
Familiar.Name: Granite Thresher

Familiar.FlavourText: Skira use their long necks and even longer tongues to strip leaves from the highest branches of grassland trees.
Familiar.Name: Grassland Skira

Familiar.FlavourText: Elemental acolyte of the Earthshaker. (Rockbreaker's Ceremony Holiday Item 2015.)
Familiar.Name: Granite Guardian

Familiar.FlavourText: Its long lifespan and natural armor allow this insect to reach enormous sizes. The largest recorded Goliath had a 7m wingspan!
Familiar.Name: Goliath Mountain Beetle

Familiar.FlavourText: This small, squat herbivore is almost too docile and cute to eat. You decide to take it back to the lair and bestow "all the cuddles."
Familiar.Name: Grasslands Trunker

Familiar.FlavourText: Guardian of the Scarred Wasteland. (Riot of Rot 2014.)
Familiar.Name: Graveyard Guardian

Familiar.FlavourText: But is it really that great?
Familiar.Name: Great Blue Waveskimmer

Familiar.FlavourText: A sandstrike will bury itself until only its spines are exposed. It is an ambush predator.
Familiar.Name: Greater Sandstrike

Familiar.FlavourText: The reek from an expired greatshell is abominable. Young dragons take great delight in depositing uneaten corpses near the lairs of rival clans.
Familiar.Name: Greatshell

Familiar.FlavourText: Even the largest and strongest dragons have a hard time besting a Greattusk; their immense size, weight, and sharp tusks make them formidable adversaries.
Familiar.Name: Greattusk

Familiar.FlavourText: One can catch more flies with honey than vinegar - however both of these methods are inferior to using a Janustrap!
Familiar.Name: Greenroot Janustrap

Familiar.FlavourText: This warrior's uncanny ability to mimic draconic speech allows it to repeat the battle cries of its foes.
Familiar.Name: Greenwing Razorclaw

Familiar.FlavourText: A playful and mischievous familiar. River Flights will often sneak into dragon lairs and abscond with shiny bits of treasure.
Familiar.Name: Grey River Flight

Familiar.FlavourText: These fearful Corven are said to be the shepherds of the lost spirits of recently deceased Talonok.
Familiar.Name: Greybeak Reaper

Familiar.FlavourText: Breaking the gaze of a grouse basilisk is not too difficult if attacked in pairs; they startle easily!
Familiar.Name: Grouse Basilisk

Familiar.FlavourText: If one listens very carefully, they can follow the notes of a grove piper's song through even the darkest and most twisted forest maze. If the tune fades, best take a different path.
Familiar.Name: Grove Piper

Familiar.FlavourText: Is a group of hainu a flock or a pack?
Familiar.Name: Hainu

Familiar.FlavourText: The eyes of the Windsinger. (Mistral Jamboree Holiday Familiar 2017.)
Familiar.Name: Gusting Goblin

Familiar.FlavourText: These agile creatures cast dragon-shaped shadows as they dart through the sky. (Colored by Ursus.)
Familiar.Name: Harlequin Stagwing

Familiar.FlavourText: The leaves of this floracat become a brilliant, fiery display before they are shed and regrown each season.(Colored by akitamonster.)
Familiar.Name: Harvest Floracat

Familiar.FlavourText: These tough land crabs don't give a lot of sustenance, but they're experts at taking it.
Familiar.Name: Harvest Hardshell

Familiar.FlavourText: While primarily scavengers, Bonepickers will band together to finish off prey that's still got a little kick left!
Familiar.Name: Highreach Bonepicker

Familiar.FlavourText: Brother to Sköll, Hati seeks to devour the moon.
Familiar.Name: Hati

Familiar.FlavourText: Hedgehogs remain at the top of the ''Most Un-Digestible Snack Food'' list. It's no speedier than any other hedgehog, alas.
Familiar.Name: Hedgehog

Familiar.FlavourText: Guardian of the Starfall Isles. (Starfall Celebration 2014.)
Familiar.Name: Hibernal Starbear

Familiar.FlavourText: A Hawksbill Goliath often out-competes or consumes other aquatic predators in its native pond.
Familiar.Name: Hawksbill Goliath

Familiar.FlavourText: Named for their outer display, heartred croakers are various shades of brown and green on the inside.
Familiar.Name: Heartred Croaker

Familiar.FlavourText: While they are at home in the water, hydrenas can often be seen skulking among the dust-parched boneyards of dead Greattusks, waiting to ambush overconfident hatchlings.
Familiar.Name: Heckling Hydrena

Familiar.FlavourText: Several times the length of most dragons, these sinuous serpents possess dangerous, spined fins.
Familiar.Name: Highfin Sea Serpent

Familiar.FlavourText: Mistakes were made.
Familiar.Name: Hippalectryon

Familiar.FlavourText: A hippocampus never forgets.
Familiar.Name: Hippocampus

Familiar.FlavourText: A terrifying bearbeast with a really sour expression. I bet it's because there's a bunch of ice shards stuck in his back.
Familiar.Name: Hoarfrost Mauler

Familiar.FlavourText: This bird once had only two eyes, but was completely blind. Luckily for the future of the species, it has evolved to possess four additional sightless eyes.
Familiar.Name: Hooded Dodo

Familiar.FlavourText: A preferred mount when non-feathered Beastclans need to become airborne. A greatowl can keep pace with most species of dragon in flight.
Familiar.Name: Hulking Greatowl

Familiar.FlavourText: Elemental acolyte of the Windsinger. (Mistral Jamboree Holiday Item 2016.)
Familiar.Name: Hurricane Herald

Familiar.FlavourText: Hippogriffs are more social creatures than their gryphon cousins. Their ability to consume meat and grain means that more of them may occupy the same territory.
Familiar.Name: Hippogriff

Familiar.FlavourText: Hippojays are happiest in the sky, but never pass up an opportunity to nap in the grasslands.
Familiar.Name: Hippojay

Familiar.FlavourText: Will you forget the head-slicing thing?!
Familiar.Name: Hydra

Familiar.FlavourText: It is said that if you cut off the tail of a hydra scorpion, two more will grow in its place.
Familiar.Name: Hydra Scorpion

Familiar.FlavourText: Imps are notorious for seeking an evil overlord to follow. Left to their own devices, these creatures' unchecked mischief can cause a lot of damage.
Familiar.Name: Ignited Imp

Familiar.FlavourText: Dripping with disease, these hellish hounds disguise themselves as carcasses. They prey on unsuspecting scavengers that come to feast.
Familiar.Name: Infestation Hound

Familiar.FlavourText: Entourage of the Icewarden. (Crystalline Gala Holiday Familiar 2014.)
Familiar.Name: Ice Sprite

Familiar.FlavourText: A creature of uncommon artifice. It collects ichor for its patron.
Familiar.Name: Ichor Nymph

Familiar.FlavourText: Normally, the warning "don't wear a shroud that can whisper" would be enough, but this just goes so great with your new genes.
Familiar.Name: Inquisitive Shroud

Familiar.FlavourText: Creatures living within the Starwood Strand may be enchanted... (Colored by Soro.)
Familiar.Name: Inscribed Pangolin

Familiar.FlavourText: Ride the iron golem through a storm at midnight; metal!
Familiar.Name: Iron Golem

Familiar.FlavourText: Its lack of fur should not be seen as detriment, but an amazing opportunity to knit tiny kitty sweaters.
Familiar.Name: Irregular Nekomata

Familiar.FlavourText: Elemental acolyte of the Shadowbinder. (Trickmurk Circus Holiday Item 2016.)
Familiar.Name: Insubstantial Illusionist

Familiar.FlavourText: Gaze as far into the stars as you may; their domain is fathomless.
Familiar.Name: Irradiated Astronomer

Familiar.FlavourText: Dig, dig as far as you can; the rabbit hole is bottomless.
Familiar.Name: Bucktooth Digger

Familiar.FlavourText: There's something off about this bear...
Familiar.Name: Jadecarved Decoy

Familiar.FlavourText: Jawlockers have sharper teeth than most dragons, and a bite just as powerful.
Familiar.Name: Jawlocker

Familiar.FlavourText: Iridescent Scalebacks are a more lovely version of the disgruntled Scaleback. They're still fueled by malcontent.
Familiar.Name: Iridescent Scaleback

Familiar.FlavourText: One of the stalks keeps track of where flies will be, while the other monitors where dragons have been.
Familiar.Name: Janustrap

Familiar.FlavourText: Much more refined than a regular octoflyer: peasants!
Familiar.Name: Jeweled Octoflyer

Familiar.FlavourText: These gentle creatures graze on the smaller algaes and grasses that occassionally take root on the surface of kelp forests.
Familiar.Name: Kelp Tender

Familiar.FlavourText: King Parda designates neither gender nor royalty; these feline creatures are a much larger subspecies of Parda.
Familiar.Name: King Parda

Familiar.FlavourText: Although lionsnakes may seem like the leaders of grasslands, these supercharged cheetahs use the atmosphere of the region to aid their sprints, almost never tiring when closing in on their prey.
Familiar.Name: King Quillrunner

Familiar.FlavourText: A playful swirl of loosely bound aether and stardust.
Familiar.Name: Juvenile Starsweeper

Familiar.FlavourText: Most dragons are too large to practically ride a kelpie, and as such are regarded as allies, not prey.
Familiar.Name: Kelpie

Familiar.FlavourText: These raucous birds are known for lifting colorful thread, fabric, reeds, and feathers to weave into vibrant nests.
Familiar.Name: Lakelight Weaver

Familiar.FlavourText: There's something unsettling about this bear...
Familiar.Name: Lavaborne Hoax

Familiar.FlavourText: This large moth feeds by spreading its chlorophyll-rich wings in a patch of sunlight and flapping gently.
Familiar.Name: Leafy Moth

Familiar.FlavourText: During mating season, hundreds of coralclimbers will swim to the ocean's surface, and let out a chorus of chirps. It's very alluring... but only to other coralclimbers.
Familiar.Name: Leopard Coralclimber

Familiar.FlavourText: Colloquially known as the 'Bramblepelt', this territorial species of floron is covered in a thick brown outer coat of thorns for the majority of the year. It sheds this coat in the spring.
Familiar.Name: Lilium Floron

Familiar.FlavourText: The remains of your latest brew are bright blue, which makes absolutely no sense, given what went into it. Ah... science.
Familiar.Name: Leftover Residue

Familiar.FlavourText: When resting in crystal, a lesser wisp will slumber contentedly. When loose, they will cause all manner of mischief!
Familiar.Name: Lesser Wisp

Familiar.FlavourText: Entourage of the Lightweaver. (Brightshine Jubilee Holiday Familiar 2013.)
Familiar.Name: Light Sprite

Familiar.FlavourText: Entourage of the Stormcatcher. (Thundercrack Carnivale Holiday Familiar 2013.)
Familiar.Name: Lightning Sprite

Familiar.FlavourText: Elemental acolyte of the Stormcatcher. (Thundercrack Carnivale Holiday Item 2015.)
Familiar.Name: Lightning Lancer

Familiar.FlavourText: This fascinating fowl can actually breathe through the plant-like growths along its head and back, which is helpful considering it spends most of its time partially submerged.
Familiar.Name: Lilyfowl

Familiar.FlavourText: Hostile Serthis beastclans elevate talented assassins to their highest echelons, a major factor in pushing their society toward espionage and sabotage.
Familiar.Name: Lithetail Assassin

Familiar.FlavourText: Guardian of the Shifting Expanse. (Thundercrack Carnivale 2014.)
Familiar.Name: Livewire Grizzly

Familiar.FlavourText: A brilliant dancing balloon that chooses to float neither up nor down. Unreliable for a birthday party.
Familiar.Name: Living Luminance

Familiar.FlavourText: This marble sculpture moves to block the path of anyone trying to pass by.
Familiar.Name: Living Sculpture

Familiar.FlavourText: For the second anniversary it is customary to exchange loga. No one is sure who thought this tradition was a good idea. (2015 Anniversary Familiar)
Familiar.Name: Loga

Familiar.FlavourText: Impatient, unattended capricats will sometimes eat their food can and all!
Familiar.Name: Longhorn Capricat

Familiar.FlavourText: A lurefish is a cunning predator. They will burrow into soft mud until only their eyes and lure are exposed. They prey upon the birds who are attracted by their ruse.
Familiar.Name: Longjaw Lurefish

Familiar.FlavourText: Here for battle and glory! May it find both!
Familiar.Name: Longneck Gladiator

Familiar.FlavourText: These brave longneck equip themselves with a winter coat over their winter coat.
Familiar.Name: Longneck Hunter

Familiar.FlavourText: The Longneck clans are mainly indigenous to the mountains of Dragonhome. Lately, they have been encroaching elsewhere. This one is a scout.
Familiar.Name: Longneck Interloper

Familiar.FlavourText: Longneck Magi train for years to master the art of harnessing the arcane energies of the world. What comes naturally to dragons is a rare gift in other peoples.
Familiar.Name: Longneck Magi

Familiar.FlavourText: Often mistrusted, these occult-seeking acolytes wander ruins and graveyards, calling softly to beings unseen.
Familiar.Name: Longneck Medium

Familiar.FlavourText: Longneck Menders have set aside the staff of war and taken up the staff of healing. They support their clan brothers, sisters, and beasts, creating a formidable team.
Familiar.Name: Longneck Mender

Familiar.FlavourText: Though most Longnecks take up tools of the land, some seek higher forms of learning, opting to lead intellectually.
Familiar.Name: Longneck Scholar

Familiar.FlavourText: Good at scrappin' and at wearing scrap metal.
Familiar.Name: Longneck Scrapper

Familiar.FlavourText: While the Longneck Interlopers are scouts, Skirmishers are fighters, trained to act as guardsmen to the territorial clans that roam the mountains.
Familiar.Name: Longneck Skirmisher

Familiar.FlavourText: These adventurous trail blazers are sent to scout and map new territories for the rest of their clan.
Familiar.Name: Longneck Wanderer

Familiar.FlavourText: This otherwordly insect's wings hum with a soothing melody.
Familiar.Name: Luna Mith

Familiar.FlavourText: These impish spectres appear at the edges of one's vision when the nights are darkest. It remains unknown if they truly exist, or if they are a figment of the mind.
Familiar.Name: Lux Spectre

Familiar.FlavourText: It takes a patient dragon to raise a Longwing Epiptite from a larvae.
Familiar.Name: Longwing Epiptite

Familiar.FlavourText: On the brightest of days, these stoic faun-like creatures can be seen traveling between light lairs, building alliances with dragonkind. (Brightshine Jubilee 2018 Holiday Item)
Familiar.Name: Luminous Ambassador

Familiar.FlavourText: While not appealing to a dragon, its tendril is alluring to other fish.
Familiar.Name: Lurefish

Familiar.FlavourText: Mirror, mirror on the wall, who's the greatest of them all? It's me. It's me isn't it? Confirm!!!
Familiar.Name: Magic Mirror

Familiar.FlavourText: A creature of uncommon intellect. It harvests magic for its patron.
Familiar.Name: Magic Nymph

Familiar.FlavourText: Guardian of the Ashfall Waste. (Flameforgers Festival 2014.)
Familiar.Name: Magma Embear

Familiar.FlavourText: The scales of this cobra will stand on end when agitated, creating an impressive mane.
Familiar.Name: Maned Cobra

Familiar.FlavourText: It is difficult to discern these quick lizards from their surroundings. When the heat goes up, bioluminescent membranes in their leathery skin begin to glow a deep red.
Familiar.Name: Magma Runner

Familiar.FlavourText: The Magpie Sphinx will often try to camouflage itself with the sky of the savanna, which is always a roiling amalgamation of the grays and blacks of the storm season.
Familiar.Name: Magpie Sphinx

Familiar.FlavourText: Dragons once mistook mammertee aggregations for schools of maren, taking care to avoid the waters they grazed in.
Familiar.Name: Mammertee

Familiar.FlavourText: House as far away from Ashscale Ophiotaurus as possible, or this may be your last cerdae.
Familiar.Name: Maned Cerdae

Familiar.FlavourText: A lumbering mass of bones. This shambling horror is draped in rotting cloth and surrounded by a shroud of thick mist.
Familiar.Name: Malevolent Spirit

Familiar.FlavourText: Those who venture into deep waters may see a glimmer in the distance: avoid it.
Familiar.Name: Mantarune

Familiar.FlavourText: The Maned Rasa's fur winter coat is white. While in its winter garb it is often mistaken for its cousin, the more aggressive Squall Rasa.
Familiar.Name: Maned Rasa

Familiar.FlavourText: While one of these tiny manticore may appear helpless, it's friends, family, and former roommates are but a scream away...
Familiar.Name: Manticore Screamer

Familiar.FlavourText: The ornamental clothes worn by these foo are typically bestowed when they have done a great service to the Talonok beastclans.
Familiar.Name: Mantled Foo

Familiar.FlavourText: It's a grand thing when a manticore deigns to hang around a dragon.
Familiar.Name: Manticore

Familiar.FlavourText: Manticore are often hired by other beastclan tribes to perform espionage in thick jungles or dense woodlands due to their exceptional prowling abilities.
Familiar.Name: Manticorian Provocateur

Familiar.FlavourText: The rustling sounds in the forest are not trees, but diners.
Familiar.Name: Maple Caterpillar

Familiar.FlavourText: Trust the jester for only one night; their nature is ever mischievous.
Familiar.Name: Marbled Jester

Familiar.FlavourText: The brilliant coloring of the marbled serpenta is short-lived; a year after reaching adulthood, it molts and a dull gray coat covers its body. (Colored by weyrbound.)
Familiar.Name: Marbled Serpenta

Familiar.FlavourText: Some Maren bloodlines carry the ability to adjust the chromatophores in the skin, allowing for a chameleon-like defense.
Familiar.Name: Maren Ambusher

Familiar.FlavourText: Maren do not venture beyond their cities without first sending an advance scout.
Familiar.Name: Maren Scout

Familiar.FlavourText: One must be honorable, fast, and fearless to take up the mantle of currentfinder. Many Maren tribes rely heavily on these champions to find safe paths to new waters.
Familiar.Name: Maren Currentfinder

Familiar.FlavourText: Specialized members of each tribe specifically keep a look out for larger threatening sharks and whales.
Familiar.Name: Maren Shark Hunter

Familiar.FlavourText: These warriors stick to the front lines, protecting any civilians and magic users from harm.
Familiar.Name: Maren Defender

Familiar.FlavourText: It is tradition for young maren warriors to prove themselves by hunting dangerous sharks and terrors of the deep. The fruits of this hunt provide them with the materials for their weapons.
Familiar.Name: Maren Spearmaiden

Familiar.FlavourText: Beware crossing a warlock...
Familiar.Name: Maren Warlock

Familiar.FlavourText: Those Maren who take up trident and claw are adept aquatic fighters.
Familiar.Name: Maren Warrior

Familiar.FlavourText: Maren Wavesingers maintain a strong connection with the elements, and may guide currents to the advantage of their schools.
Familiar.Name: Maren Wavesinger

Familiar.FlavourText: Sometimes mistaken for a tundra dragon from the air.
Familiar.Name: Marshland Poodle Mith

Familiar.FlavourText: Harpies build their nests in many of the same locations where dragons make their lairs. Territory is highly contested.
Familiar.Name: Masked Harpy

Familiar.FlavourText: The powerful talons of harpies can crush the bones of their prey.
Familiar.Name: Mesacliff Harpy

Familiar.FlavourText: A disgruntled Melprin is not easily removed from its burrow.
Familiar.Name: Melprin

Familiar.FlavourText: The ethereal body of this creature is invisible to the naked eye. One may only see a lone bouncing mask floating down a darkened hallway...
Familiar.Name: Masked Phantom

Familiar.FlavourText: Once a marzal ripens, it behaves more like an animal than a plant. Ripe melon marzals will uproot from their parent plant, travel great distances, then burrow to become a new plant.
Familiar.Name: Melon Marzal

Familiar.FlavourText: This buttersnake mimics an angry spirit, or was it the other way around? (Colored by Hund.)
Familiar.Name: Mimic Buttersnake

Familiar.FlavourText: The mock firebird is not a firebird at all. This avian’s plumage mimics the colors of a true firebird to protect it from predators.
Familiar.Name: Mock Firebird

Familiar.FlavourText: A miniaturized globe of Sornieth hovering over a polished brass base. Animated clouds move across its intricate surface as it rotates. (Bounty of the Elements Gift - 2018)
Familiar.Name: Miniature Sornieth Globe

Familiar.FlavourText: Intent on sowing distrust among light dragon clans, this false diplomat travels the Sunbeam Ruins crying fabricated omens.
Familiar.Name: Mistyhollow Agent

Familiar.FlavourText: The venom of an agitated puffer can cause a dragon to see double.
Familiar.Name: Mirage Puffer

Familiar.FlavourText: The wind spirit inhabiting this shell is delighted to have more ways to cause mischief!
Familiar.Name: Mistral Minion

Familiar.FlavourText: Some may find watching mist to be dull, but this Shellion is quite entertained.
Familiar.Name: Mistwatch Shellion

Familiar.FlavourText: Enjoys throwing its weight around. Pity that weight means very little to most dragons.
Familiar.Name: Mith Bruiser

Familiar.FlavourText: To maintain its magma armor, molten wartoads will ingest and melt rocks.
Familiar.Name: Molten Wartoad

Familiar.FlavourText: These small golems break everything that they attempt to repair.
Familiar.Name: Monkey Wrench

Familiar.FlavourText: Have you ever danced with a crayfish in the moonlight? If not, opportunity is knocking.
Familiar.Name: Moonbeam Crayfish

Familiar.FlavourText: Nocturnal, these sentient mushrooms are not interested in the passage of dragons.
Familiar.Name: Moonlight Fungi

Familiar.FlavourText: Created by a long-lost earth clan, these golems have slumbered for thousands of years.
Familiar.Name: Moss-Covered Golem

Familiar.FlavourText: Unicorns have always produced Cerdae, unicorns without healing abilities. Recently the birth rate of cerdae has skyrocketed, leaving some dragons to wonder if unicorns are dying out.
Familiar.Name: Mossy Cerdae

Familiar.FlavourText: Elemental acolyte of the Flamecaller. (Flameforger's Festival Holiday Item 2015.)
Familiar.Name: Molten Marauder

Familiar.FlavourText: Faceoffs between trunkers are a lot like jousting; they use the hard plates along their flanks and legs to try and knock their opponent off-kilter.
Familiar.Name: Moordwelling Trunker

Familiar.FlavourText: Manipulates dragons by pretending to be something that it is not. The color of this chameleon and its gemstones are ever-changing.
Familiar.Name: Nephrite Chameleon

Familiar.FlavourText: Entourage of the Gladekeeper. (Greenskeeper Gathering Holiday Familiar 2014.)
Familiar.Name: Nature Sprite

Familiar.FlavourText: Guardian of the Tangled Wood. (Trickmurk Circus 2015.)
Familiar.Name: Murktooth Bramblekeep

Familiar.FlavourText: Beware this snake's deadly vestigial arms. (Colored by Oxygene.)
Familiar.Name: Mottled Buttersnake

Familiar.FlavourText: Maren schools have recently begun collecting Sea Serpent eggs in hopes of domesticating the species.
Familiar.Name: Mottled Sea Serpent

Familiar.FlavourText: As at home in the air as it is beneath the waves.
Familiar.Name: Murkbottom Gull

Familiar.FlavourText: A loyal, but forgetful companion.
Familiar.Name: Myosotis Fox

Familiar.FlavourText: Fantastic at devouring pond flora, except that which is deposited on its back.
Familiar.Name: Mossy Pohip

Familiar.FlavourText: Often seen where lava meets the sea, these elusive imps use the guise of smoke to befuddle assailants, or even trick them into falling in the boiling water off the coast.
Familiar.Name: Nightfall Imp

Familiar.FlavourText: This eerie equine creature is surprisingly sweet, but will only make itself known in dreams to those who have witnessed a death.
Familiar.Name: Nightmare

Familiar.FlavourText: Scavengers with a keen sense of smell, Fuiran are notorious for digging up the carrion that other desert predators have stashed beneath the sands.
Familiar.Name: Nightsky Fuiran

Familiar.FlavourText: A haphazard union of spare parts. (KS-Sponsored by Zen.)
Familiar.Name: Nochnyr

Familiar.FlavourText: Rumored to live in the sewers below the hewn city, noggles are said to grow to astonishing sizes. Dragons beware.
Familiar.Name: Noggle

Familiar.FlavourText: The vibrant colors warn off many predators, yet some dragons find themselves fascinated by the hues.
Familiar.Name: Noxious Coralclimber

Familiar.FlavourText: Decades of study have allowed these scholars to tap into elemental magics previously known only to dragonkind.
Familiar.Name: Oceansurf Magus

Familiar.FlavourText: The eyes of the Shadowbinder. (Trickmurk Circus Holiday Familiar 2017.)
Familiar.Name: Obscuring Goblin

Familiar.FlavourText: It is not amused.
Familiar.Name: Orange Blotch Pansy

Familiar.FlavourText: Fire! Water! Ice! What could these rival elements possibly come together to encapsulate?! Probably steam...
Familiar.Name: Opposing Forces

Familiar.FlavourText: Attracted to anything and all things spherical, these specters can often be seen haunting Pearlcatcher enclaves.
Familiar.Name: Orbiting Spirit

Familiar.FlavourText: These invertebrates may leap from the water and glide short distances. Water clan hatchlings enjoy watching them smack into things.
Familiar.Name: Octoflyer

Familiar.FlavourText: While the opheodrys serthis' remarks and quick wit are venomous, its fangs are not.
Familiar.Name: Opheodrys Serthis

Familiar.FlavourText: A combination of a bone-crushing squeeze and a powerful front kick is likely what comes at the end of an altercation with this monster.
Familiar.Name: Ophiotaurus

Familiar.FlavourText: A jumble of bones and magic. When you can't find a familiar, make one!
Familiar.Name: Otherworldly Aura

Familiar.FlavourText: If you purchased this silverbeast from the auction house, you were likely overcharged.
Familiar.Name: Overcharged Silverbeast

Familiar.FlavourText: Though some centaur will paint their coats before going to battle, others boast a naturally mottled coloration.
Familiar.Name: Painted Centaur

Familiar.FlavourText: But have you ever seen a Greattusk fly?
Familiar.Name: Pale Greattusk

Familiar.FlavourText: Most tadhop do not grow beyond the juvenile stage.
Familiar.Name: Palefoot Tadhop

Familiar.FlavourText: These creatures subsist on a diet of fruit. Their ability to spread seeds across a range is vital to their jungle ecosystems.
Familiar.Name: Paradise Zalis

Familiar.FlavourText: Paddyfowl are often a nuisance for Sornieth's smaller amphibians, who mistake the paddyleaves along their body as gentle places to rest.
Familiar.Name: Paddyfowl

Familiar.FlavourText: A dancing, skittering dragon puppet, moving without a puppeteer. Or is it?
Familiar.Name: Painted Marionette

Familiar.FlavourText: This would look sensational in an ornamental pond.
Familiar.Name: Painted Protobeast

Familiar.FlavourText: Racing pangolin may be a bit odd, but every dragon's gotta have a hobby. (Colored by MsBarrows.)
Familiar.Name: Pangolin Racer

Familiar.FlavourText: Peacock firebirds lack the color mimicry of their mock-firebird cousins. They tend to live short lives.
Familiar.Name: Peacock Firebird

Familiar.FlavourText: Pangolin are known for digging their own tunnels and passageways into subterranean lairs. (Colored by Nuuskamuikkunen.)
Familiar.Name: Patina Pangolin

Familiar.FlavourText: Known for staying awake for days on end.
Familiar.Name: Perching Java Sparrow

Familiar.FlavourText: With a wiggle and a shake, fast friends you two shall make!
Familiar.Name: Peacock Spider

Familiar.FlavourText: Parasitic Fungus releases spores into the air that control the creatures they root in. The chances for a spore successfully blooming are small.
Familiar.Name: Parasitic Fungus

Familiar.FlavourText: These evolutionary oddities lay eggs but nurse their young. They also chirp!
Familiar.Name: Parda

Familiar.FlavourText: This aardvark is known for its strange ritual of hibernating above ground in the middle of spring, only to awaken again during autumn. It then spends a very productive winter below ground.
Familiar.Name: Peacevine Aardvark

Familiar.FlavourText: Male peacock scorpions are considerably more colorful than their female counterparts.
Familiar.Name: Peacock Scorpion

Familiar.FlavourText: These creatures freeze, then skewer their victims. (KS-Sponsored by Zen.)
Familiar.Name: Permafrost Impaler

Familiar.FlavourText: These insects are adept at disguising among patches of flowers. They are so adept that other petal jumpers may conceal themselves among their own kind by mistake.
Familiar.Name: Petal Jumper

Familiar.FlavourText: This elusive feline prowls within flower beds, using its natural camouflage for the perfect strike.
Familiar.Name: Petalmane Floron

Familiar.FlavourText: The centaur beastclans have long excelled at diplomacy, and much of that can be attributed to their usage of bards and music to ease tensions.
Familiar.Name: Plainstrider Bard

Familiar.FlavourText: Though most peryton flocks nest high on cliffs and in trees, petalwing perytons can be found grazing in huge groups where the southern Starfall Isles begin to splinter and freeze into ice floes. (Colored by Virgo.)
Familiar.Name: Petalwing Peryton

Familiar.FlavourText: A fiery bird of indeterminate age.
Familiar.Name: Phoenix

Familiar.FlavourText: Entourage of the Plaguebringer. (Riot of Rot Holiday Familiar 2013.)
Familiar.Name: Plague Sprite

Familiar.FlavourText: Partially blind, mostly deaf, definitely odorous, and frustratingly stubborn, these subterranean critters are quite possibly Sornieth's worst pet. But just look at that face!
Familiar.Name: Pink-Tail Mole

Familiar.FlavourText: Agricultural dragon clans view the prevalence of these landbound crustaceans as a double-edged sword: a bountiful season produces both a successful harvest and a rampant pest problem.
Familiar.Name: Plantation Pincher

Familiar.FlavourText: Believed to have noble blood, all petal geckos are royal. This one is 124,193rd in line for the gecko throne! (Colored by Herumi.)
Familiar.Name: Princess Petal Gecko

Familiar.FlavourText: There has never been a familiar so meticulously groomed.
Familiar.Name: Prancing Capricat

Familiar.FlavourText: These spooky receptacles are said to be the ghostly remains of mimics. (You know, in case they weren't creepy enough.)
Familiar.Name: Poltergeist Pile

Familiar.FlavourText: Guardian of the Southern Icefield. (Crystalline Gala 2015.)
Familiar.Name: Polarfreeze Defender

Familiar.FlavourText: After Toridae devour large prey items, they burrow into the marsh bed and take root. Water dotted with the blooms of their tails designate plentiful hunting grounds.
Familiar.Name: Poisonous Toridae

Familiar.FlavourText: A ghastly turkey, gobbling from beyond the grave. This bird was clearly victim of a murder most fowl, strange and unnatural. (KS-sponsored by Madame)
Familiar.Name: Poultrygeist

Familiar.FlavourText: These creatures pollinate and collect, taking care never to harvest all of a plant's blossoms.
Familiar.Name: Primrose Mith

Familiar.FlavourText: Swift and strong, these towering creatures will drop to all fours and chase away anyone that threatens their territory.
Familiar.Name: Pronghorn Stomper

Familiar.FlavourText: This species is believed to be a direct descendent of the first species of manticore.
Familiar.Name: Proto Manticore

Familiar.FlavourText: Psywurms love a good book. Usually preferring to nap on the one you're trying to read. (KS-Sponsored by Mythka.)
Familiar.Name: Psywurm

Familiar.FlavourText: A fight with a Quillrunner is a dangerous task no matter which way one approaches.
Familiar.Name: Quillrunner

Familiar.FlavourText: Having developed an evolutionary affinity for water, it isn't uncommon to come across a family of these hyenas floating in lakes and watering holes to beat the heat.
Familiar.Name: Rabid Grinfin

Familiar.FlavourText: A magnificent animal, returned to the modern world through the powers of science!
Familiar.Name: Protobeast

Familiar.FlavourText: Though most cockatrice may turn an opponent to stone, this variety produces a different mineral. (Colored by Wythern.)
Familiar.Name: Quartz Cockatrice

Familiar.FlavourText: Quetzeels are a sign of good luck for fishers, as they're hunting patterns closely mirror the peak breeding seasons of many species of fish.
Familiar.Name: Quetzeel

Familiar.FlavourText: This vibrant varmint is a mutation on the already-rare Flutterbun. Impossible to miss when the sun goes down, too.
Familiar.Name: Radiant Flutterbun

Familiar.FlavourText: Ragamice are not content to scavenge the scraps tossed outside a lair, and will plunder the food stores of dragon hoards.
Familiar.Name: Ragamouse

Familiar.FlavourText: Spawned in The Wyrmwound, this slime has taken on a life of its own. It envelops everything in its path, leaving bones and bare rock in its wake.
Familiar.Name: Radioactive Slime

Familiar.FlavourText: Be wary of disturbing a hive of Rainbow Sprites. The swarm will protect its home, and retreating to the water will not save you.
Familiar.Name: Rainbow Sprite

Familiar.FlavourText: Sweetpuff and Ragepuff are actually of the same species. Couples typically consist of one of each disposition; one doting parent, and one ball of protective fury!
Familiar.Name: Ragepuff

Familiar.FlavourText: Native to tropical wetlands, Rambras are known to charge headfirst into overwhelming odds.
Familiar.Name: Rambra

Familiar.FlavourText: It takes a true master of blades to be able to don so many without an accident.
Familiar.Name: Raptorik Bladedancer

Familiar.FlavourText: Although agriculture and animal husbandry are rare on the savanna, some Raptorik beastclans have developed a way to lure herds into traps and enclosures for easy hunting.
Familiar.Name: Raptorik Herder

Familiar.FlavourText: Announces their allies and opponents with a flourish. A coveted position in any arena.
Familiar.Name: Raptorik Ringmaster

Familiar.FlavourText: These beastclan emissaries act as guides in the great trek across the grasslands. Some tribes have allied with dragonkind to earn a steady income of gold.
Familiar.Name: Raptorik Wanderer

Familiar.FlavourText: A molting raptorik becomes twice as dangerous.
Familiar.Name: Raptorik Warrior

Familiar.FlavourText: The alpha of each flock leads the yearly migration, taking the lead position in the V-formation.
Familiar.Name: Red-Breasted Hainu

Familiar.FlavourText: The male red-winged owlcat displays vibrant red plumage across its wings. The female is much plainer, but much more deadly for its camouflage.
Familiar.Name: Red-Winged Owlcat

Familiar.FlavourText: Long live the king.
Familiar.Name: Rat King

Familiar.FlavourText: This cauldron needs just one more ingredient...YOU!
Familiar.Name: Ravenous Cauldron

Familiar.FlavourText: This peculiar fowl collects any unattended eggs it may find, creating a vast nest of pilfered eggs to brood over.
Familiar.Name: Red-Footed Akirbeak

Familiar.FlavourText: Long-standing scientific journalism has stated that this species of frog can only regenerate 12 times, but that has recently been proven false.
Familiar.Name: Regenerating Reedjumper

Familiar.FlavourText: The squawks of Rivermouth Flatbills can carry for a mile. Dragons prefer not to settle near Flatbill territory; the creatures are nocturnal.
Familiar.Name: Rivermouth Flatbill

Familiar.FlavourText: When slain, the organic portions of this creature wither away. The remaining armored plates collect energy from the currents and may regenerate a new specimen.
Familiar.Name: Relic Eel

Familiar.FlavourText: Though incapable of true flight, Aviar are able to glide short distances. (KS-sponsored by ZeSethis.)
Familiar.Name: Renegade Aviar

Familiar.FlavourText: A companion for the dragon who likes to outshine their fellows.
Familiar.Name: Rhodochrosite Crane

Familiar.FlavourText: Small enough for even a fae dragon to hold.
Familiar.Name: Ringlet Amphithere

Familiar.FlavourText: Watch your step!
Familiar.Name: Riptide Clipper

Familiar.FlavourText: Scraped off of the underside of a dock, this river muck appears to be moving...
Familiar.Name: River Muck

Familiar.FlavourText: Many dragons will attempt to plant their stranglers near others with an eye for desirable color outcomes. However, the stranglers have a mind of their own and will often uproot and move to a place more to their liking.
Familiar.Name: Rosaline Strangler

Familiar.FlavourText: Empowered by revenge and a strong jolt of electrical energy, this rampaging beast will stop at nothing to trample its would-be captors.
Familiar.Name: Roundhorn Rager

Familiar.FlavourText: The imposing form of this great beast can look like a pile of boulders... until it's too late.
Familiar.Name: Rockback Charger

Familiar.FlavourText: Like a roc, it was strong as it could be.
Familiar.Name: Roc

Familiar.FlavourText: This imposing-looking caiman is actually more afraid of you than you are of it. (Colored by Prawnlegs.)
Familiar.Name: Rosetail

Familiar.FlavourText: Dragons that keep rosy lake cormorants as familiars must learn to live with the fact that any seafood that was about to grace their dinner plate is in great peril.
Familiar.Name: Rosy Lake Cormorant

Familiar.FlavourText: Though mythology indicates the dangerous nature of perytons, this species has learned to live harmoniously with dragonkind. (Colored by Nochnyr.)
Familiar.Name: Rosy Peryton

Familiar.FlavourText: Melprin use their horns to help clear debris as they tunnel.
Familiar.Name: Roundhorn Melprin

Familiar.FlavourText: Fiercely competitive when feeding, collisions between glasswings are common.
Familiar.Name: Ruffle Glasswing

Familiar.FlavourText: This golem's seen better days, but it will always be your truest friend.
Familiar.Name: Rusty Golem

Familiar.FlavourText: This offshoot species of lionsnake often spends much more time lying in wait than its golden cousin, using thick grasses and its speckled coat to blend into the terrain.
Familiar.Name: Roving Lionsnake

Familiar.FlavourText: This hummingbird never stops growing. Pray that it is not altered any further.
Familiar.Name: Ruby Webwing

Familiar.FlavourText: An appealing coloration and an almost cute demeanor masks nature's most unlikely beast of bloodlust. Ruffletail tadhops are not to be trifled with.
