Familiar.Name: Ruffletail Tadhop

Familiar.FlavourText: Runic bats feed exclusively off of the mana thieves of Crystalspine Reaches.
Familiar.Name: Runic Bat

Familiar.FlavourText: The sakura owl blooms only once a year. Many forest denizens will journey long distances to witness the event. Not all of the visitors return...
Familiar.Name: Sakura Owl

Familiar.FlavourText: The last to arrive to any scene, this kamaitachi cleans up after its inconsiderate siblings. (KS-Sponsored by Larthan.)
Familiar.Name: Salve Kamaitachi

Familiar.FlavourText: Known for sharp claws and sharp retorts.
Familiar.Name: Sandshore Snipper

Familiar.FlavourText: Their fins are as expressive as their ears.
Familiar.Name: Satin Pocketmouse

Familiar.FlavourText: Scalebacks are always smelly, always hungry, and always in a bad mood. They're always a good idea to avoid.
Familiar.Name: Scaleback

Familiar.FlavourText: Nature... why?
Familiar.Name: Scaleside Noggle

Familiar.FlavourText: When this ferocious fish is not busy snapping at insects, it can be seen jumping upstream. Even bears know better than to mess with these.
Familiar.Name: Scarlet Flycatcher

Familiar.FlavourText: Scrapmetal Trackers are able to sense tiny bits of metal buried in the earth. They dig up these remnants and bring them to their masters.
Familiar.Name: Scrapmetal Tracker

Familiar.FlavourText: Elemental acolyte of the Gladekeeper. (Greenskeeper Gathering Holiday Item 2016.)
Familiar.Name: Sapling Speaker

Familiar.FlavourText: The coat of a scarlet serpenta's vibrant namesake is only red for a two week duration each year. When this change occurs the serpenta is dangerous and unpredictable. (Colored by NeroGravity.)
Familiar.Name: Scarlet Serpenta

Familiar.FlavourText: Bits of ocean debris that are incorrectly filtered build up inside of these bicorn whales. Upon discovering a carcass, dragons may find a treasure trove of resources inside! (Colored by Frye.)
Familiar.Name: Seaglass Swimmer

Familiar.FlavourText: Elemental acolyte of the Tidelord. (Wavecrest Saturnalia Holiday Item 2016.)
Familiar.Name: Seawater Savior

Familiar.FlavourText: Seaweed Scavengers will harvest fresh stalks of seaweed to maintain an ideal sanctuary in which to raise their young.
Familiar.Name: Seaweed Scavenger

Familiar.FlavourText: This globule is capable of thinking and feeling and making its own decisions; too bad it will never be taken seriously with a face like that.
Familiar.Name: Sentient Alloy

Familiar.FlavourText: This spirit rides in the wake of other kamaitachi, delivering several shallow cuts to anyone unfortunate enough to stand in its path. (KS-Sponsored by Larthan.)
Familiar.Name: Scythe Kamaitachi

Familiar.FlavourText: This species of hare has flame retardant coat. When navigating scorched terrain, stray embers are frequently caught in its horns.
Familiar.Name: Searing Jackalope

Familiar.FlavourText: Mecha mail makes a mild-mannered mith mighty!
Familiar.Name: Sentinel Mith

Familiar.FlavourText: For when warning beeps, tones, alarms, whistles, horns, and blasts just aren't enough.
Familiar.Name: Sentry Squawker

Familiar.FlavourText: Its deadly natural venom is not the only toxin one must contend with when battling a Serthis.
Familiar.Name: Serthis Alchemist

Familiar.FlavourText: Scrollkeepers for the Flamescale clan, these studious serthis are careful to protect their writings from wayward embers and open flames.
Familiar.Name: Serthis Archivist

Familiar.FlavourText: As the legend goes: parchment and flame do not mix.
Familiar.Name: Serthis Loremaster

Familiar.FlavourText: This potions specialist has been trying to teach shadow magic for five years... but the congregation keeps passing him over for less-experienced Serthis.
Familiar.Name: Serthis Potionmaster

Familiar.FlavourText: A Toridae of unusual size.
Familiar.Name: Sewer Toridae

Familiar.FlavourText: It's difficult to discern what the serpenta is hoping to camouflage itself as, but you're pretty sure it doesn't need to. Run! (Colored by arctictis.)
Familiar.Name: Serpenta

Familiar.FlavourText: The spirit of this lamp has been known to throw a hissy fit.
Familiar.Name: Serpentine Lamp

Familiar.FlavourText: A life-like statue, or a clever trick?
Familiar.Name: Serthis Support

Familiar.FlavourText: Entourage of the Shadowbinder. (Trickmurk Circus Holiday Familiar 2014.)
Familiar.Name: Shadow Sprite

Familiar.FlavourText: These salamanders will carry their young on their backs from egg to adolescent. They are one of the few amphibians to produce small clutches.
Familiar.Name: Shimmering Xolo

Familiar.FlavourText: A rattle heard in the darkness.
Familiar.Name: Shadow Serpent

Familiar.FlavourText: So many Shattered Serpents live in the Abiding Boneyard that the sand itself looks as though it's rippling like an ocean.
Familiar.Name: Shattered Serpent

Familiar.FlavourText: The hide of the shale thresher flakes as it grows, forming many sharp ridges.
Familiar.Name: Shale Thresher

Familiar.FlavourText: While not very fast, they are extremely difficult to move, displace, or chip. (KS-Sponsored by Tumblebuck.)
Familiar.Name: Shalebuck

Familiar.FlavourText: In a stunning natural role reversal, the undead Shatterbone often finds itself center of attention of other carrion birds.
Familiar.Name: Shatterbone Vulture

Familiar.FlavourText: Its oily mane repels water.
Familiar.Name: Shellion

Familiar.FlavourText: This spirit has a fiery temper, and charges headlong into battle, knocking down its foes. (KS-Sponsored by Larthan.)
Familiar.Name: Sickle Kamaitachi

Familiar.FlavourText: A fancy fanrat!
Familiar.Name: Silky Fanrat

Familiar.FlavourText: One of the many mutations that this webwing has undergone has left it with luxurious plumage.
Familiar.Name: Silky Webwing

Familiar.FlavourText: This fish is your friend.
Familiar.Name: Silver Featherfin

Familiar.FlavourText: Naturally clever, silver ferrets can be trained to steal treasure from rival clans.
Familiar.Name: Silver Ferret

Familiar.FlavourText: The eyes of the Lightweaver. (Brightshine Jubilee Holiday Familiar 2016.)
Familiar.Name: Shining Goblin

Familiar.FlavourText: This reflective glop has gotta be good for something. Better hang onto it, just in case.
Familiar.Name: Shiny Residue

Familiar.FlavourText: It's really hard to keep your hair looking this good after digging around in the dirt all day. Show appreciation where it's due!
Familiar.Name: Silky Mole

Familiar.FlavourText: This imposing crustacean uses the giant fins of its tail to gracefully swim through the water. It uses its ten legs to hobble very poorly and comically across land.
Familiar.Name: Skittering Megashrimp

Familiar.FlavourText: The mask of the silver kitsune changes pattern with the phases of the moon.
Familiar.Name: Silver Kitsune

Familiar.FlavourText: These stoic creatures are routinely mistaken for elaborate stone-carved statues; they frequently stand perfectly still for several hours, waiting and watching. (Colored by Roro.)
Familiar.Name: Silvermane Barbtail

Familiar.FlavourText: Brother to Hati, Sköll seeks to devour the sun.
Familiar.Name: Sköll

Familiar.FlavourText: Graceful, majestic, stoic, and somewhat judgmental.
Familiar.Name: Silver Springbok

Familiar.FlavourText: Flocks of skycats will escort dragons through the Windswept Plateau, flying in the wake of the larger drakes.
Familiar.Name: Skycat

Familiar.FlavourText: This graceful, celestial bird uses its many supplemental eyes to easily escape anything, from the sneakiest predators to the very best ornithologists.
Familiar.Name: Slight Eyewing

Familiar.FlavourText: Thought by many to be a myth, these timid creatures may only be seen by virtuous dragons. (Colored by Bachuchuru.)
Familiar.Name: Skycrest Bicorn

Familiar.FlavourText: These noggles subsist on a diet consisting entirely of sewer sludge.
Familiar.Name: Sludge Sifter

Familiar.FlavourText: Smoke Gyres often herald the arrival of their much larger, more destructive cousin, the Firebird.
Familiar.Name: Smoke Gyre

Familiar.FlavourText: Snow Streaks are sometimes found frozen in place after particularly large snowstorms. They are easy prey.
Familiar.Name: Snow Streak

Familiar.FlavourText: Dragons bonded to bantam fangar are easily identifiable by the cloud of fur that dusts their scales at all times.
Familiar.Name: Smoky Bantam Fangar

Familiar.FlavourText: There's something fishy about this bear...
Familiar.Name: Slumbering Charlatan

Familiar.FlavourText: There's something shady about this bear...
Familiar.Name: Smokebillow Sham

Familiar.FlavourText: It is rumored that these bewitched furnishings can never truly be extinguished. Once one flame is put out, another springs to life.
Familiar.Name: Smoldering Sconce

Familiar.FlavourText: Yikes! That was the worst present ever!
Familiar.Name: Snarling Mimic

Familiar.FlavourText: The snowfall elk is crowned by an impressive pair of antlers that are never shed. Elder elk are often brought down by the weight of them.
Familiar.Name: Snowfall Elk

Familiar.FlavourText: A bundle of mismatched parts, levitating in tandem through a musty cloud of dark energy.
Familiar.Name: Somber Spirit

Familiar.FlavourText: This Podid is capable of holding its breath for up to two hours, during which time it will take a nap. Tread lightly in the marsh.
Familiar.Name: Southmarsh Podid

Familiar.FlavourText: Parry, block, chomp!
Familiar.Name: Sorcerous Arms

Familiar.FlavourText: This feline rarely grooms - those that do often become stuck! (Colored by kickingshoes.)
Familiar.Name: Snowsquall Floracat

Familiar.FlavourText: A creature of uncommon humor. It collects snowflakes for its patron.
Familiar.Name: Snowflake Nymph

Familiar.FlavourText: A creature of uncommon joy. It collects sparkles for its patron.
Familiar.Name: Sparkle Nymph

Familiar.FlavourText: The eyes of the Stormcatcher. (Thundercrack Carnivale Holiday Familiar 2016.)
Familiar.Name: Sparkling Goblin

Familiar.FlavourText: While harpies aren't typically prolific spellcasters, many have taken up apprenticeships with neutral dragon clans in the Starfall Isles. (Starfall Celebration 2018 Holiday Item)
Familiar.Name: Spellwrought Ambassador

Familiar.FlavourText: Using deft wings to dart here and there, this magical book just won't let anyone read it.
Familiar.Name: Spellbound Tome

Familiar.FlavourText: Just remember that underneath all that fuzz and carapace is a tube-like heart-of-gold.
Familiar.Name: Speckled Peacock Spider

Familiar.FlavourText: Speedy is a rebel looking for a cause.
Familiar.Name: Speedy

Familiar.FlavourText: Also known as the poor dragon's Boolean.
Familiar.Name: Sparkling Stinger

Familiar.FlavourText: Several elemental spirits have been bound to this armor.
Familiar.Name: Spellbound Golem

Familiar.FlavourText: These beasts of war are outfitted with armor that's nearly as dangerous to its rider as its opponent!
Familiar.Name: Spellwall Boran

Familiar.FlavourText: Would-be charmers would be wise to invest in a clay pot; these spiny serpents shred wicker baskets.
Familiar.Name: Spined Cobra

Familiar.FlavourText: The crystals of Vulstals drop off as the creature grows. This familiar is capable of filling a hoard with riches. (KS-Sponsored by Lune)
Familiar.Name: Spinel Vulstal

Familiar.FlavourText: Only in the past century have these mysterious leviathans begun to surface. Their origin remains unknown.
Familiar.Name: Spiney Whale

Familiar.FlavourText: None of the theories about the designer of this freaky furniture have any legs. The furniture itself has, well, plenty.
Familiar.Name: Spidered Seat

Familiar.FlavourText: This enchanted armor will roam ancient pathways, protecting the road's travelers.
Familiar.Name: Spirit Armor

Familiar.FlavourText: An etched spirit animal that contains the essence of earth. (Rockbreaker's Ceremony Holiday Familiar 2017.)
Familiar.Name: Spirit of Earth

Familiar.FlavourText: A burning spirit animal that contains the essence of fire. (Flameforger's Festival Holiday Familiar 2017.)
Familiar.Name: Spirit of Fire

Familiar.FlavourText: A snowy spirit animal that contains the essence of ice. (Crystalline Gala Holiday Familiar 2018.)
Familiar.Name: Spirit of Ice

Familiar.FlavourText: A bright spirit animal that contains the essence of light. (Brightshine Jubilee Holiday Familiar 2017.)
Familiar.Name: Spirit of Light

Familiar.FlavourText: A flashing spirit animal that contains the essence of lightning. (Thundercrack Carnivale Holiday Familiar 2017.)
Familiar.Name: Spirit of Lightning

Familiar.FlavourText: A lush spirit animal that contains the essence of nature. (Greenskeeper Gathering Holiday Familiar 2018.)
Familiar.Name: Spirit of Nature

Familiar.FlavourText: A festering spirit animal that contains the essence of plague. (Riot of Rot Holiday Familiar 2017.)
Familiar.Name: Spirit of Plague

Familiar.FlavourText: A dark spirit animal that contains the essence of shadow. (Trickmurk Circus Holiday Familiar 2018.)
Familiar.Name: Spirit of Shadow

Familiar.FlavourText: A magical spirit animal that contains the essence of the arcane. (Starfall Celebration Holiday Familiar 2017.)
Familiar.Name: Spirit of the Arcane

Familiar.FlavourText: A liquid spirit animal that contains the essence of water. (Wavecrest Saturnalia Holiday Familiar 2018.)
Familiar.Name: Spirit of Water

Familiar.FlavourText: An ephemeral spirit animal that contains the essence of wind. (Mistral Jamboree Holiday Familiar 2018.)
Familiar.Name: Spirit of Wind

Familiar.FlavourText: The eyes of the Gladekeeper. (Greenskeeper Gathering Holiday Familiar 2017.)
Familiar.Name: Sprouting Goblin

Familiar.FlavourText: Elemental acolyte of the Arcanist. (Starfall Celebration Holiday Item 2015.)
Familiar.Name: Stardust Scholar

Familiar.FlavourText: This Pukasloth has been spotted.
Familiar.Name: Spotted Pukasloth

Familiar.FlavourText: Hundreds of legs weren't enough for the Gladekeeper, eh? Had to throw in a pair of gorgeous shimmery wings...
Familiar.Name: Spring Millifae

Familiar.FlavourText: Unusually playful, a faun's interest can result in unintended mischief and mayhem.
Familiar.Name: Spotted Faun

Familiar.FlavourText: Sprangyroo begin their combat training from the moment they are able to stand on two feet.
Familiar.Name: Sprangyroo

Familiar.FlavourText: The thick, downy undercoat of the Rasa keeps it warm and dry during the long winters in Boreal Wood. Dragons prize its fur.
Familiar.Name: Squall Rasa

Familiar.FlavourText: The speckled patterns that dot this antelope's flank resemble a cluster of constellations.
Familiar.Name: Starry Ampelope

Familiar.FlavourText: This spirit hovers around The Great Furnace. It is only visible as a manifestation in the vapors of the steam produced by the forges.
Familiar.Name: Steam Gyre

Familiar.FlavourText: These golems are networked together. A pack of steelhounds can threaten smaller dragon clans.
Familiar.Name: Steelhound

Familiar.FlavourText: The armor plating on this golem was designed to withstand a cave-in. Deflecting a claw is no challenge.
Familiar.Name: Stone Borer

Familiar.FlavourText: A single harpy is a rare sight. This one is a scout for a much larger flock.
Familiar.Name: Stonewatch Harpy

Familiar.FlavourText: Males are a rarity among harpies, and are forbidden from taking up a warrior's mask.
Familiar.Name: Stonewatch Prince

Familiar.FlavourText: Storm Seekers are the heralds of bleak weather. Entire murders of them flock toward approaching thunderclouds and hurricanes.
Familiar.Name: Storm Seeker

Familiar.FlavourText: This talonok creates a distracting display, allowing its allies a greater chance at a surprise strike!
Familiar.Name: Stormclaw Showman

Familiar.FlavourText: Willing to make the best of a bad situation, these Southern Icefield refugees use their spelled snow to cool the ground where they keep their homes.
Familiar.Name: Stormcloud Harpy

Familiar.FlavourText: The strangler actively hunts once a year. It chokes its prey and buries the body. It will take root in soon-to-be fertile soil and rest for another year.
Familiar.Name: Strangler

Familiar.FlavourText: Sunbeam Dryads are only awake during the day. It's safer to travel through their territory at night.
Familiar.Name: Sunbeam Dryad

Familiar.FlavourText: A lasher rarely leaves its den, preferring to wait for prey to arrive at its doorstep before striking.
Familiar.Name: Sunset Lasher

Familiar.FlavourText: These raptors are an aggressive variant of Clouddancer. Young hatchlings have fallen prey to their talons. (KS-sponsored by Vahilor.)
Familiar.Name: Sunspot Clouddancer

Familiar.FlavourText: Elemental acolyte of the Lightweaver. (Brightshine Jubilee Holiday Item 2015.)
Familiar.Name: Sunbeam Soldier

Familiar.FlavourText: Guardian of the Sunbeam Ruins. (Brightshine Jubilee 2014.)
Familiar.Name: Sunbeam Ursa

Familiar.FlavourText: There's something jarring about this bear...
Familiar.Name: Sundial Imposter

Familiar.FlavourText: There's something suspect about this bear...
Familiar.Name: Sunsea Pseudo

Familiar.FlavourText: Also known as the Ouroboros Buttersnake. (Colored by Nubs.)
Familiar.Name: Swallowtail Buttersnake

Familiar.FlavourText: Every year as this swan returns to its nesting grounds, it chooses a new sweetheart.
Familiar.Name: Sweetheart Swan

Familiar.FlavourText: Kelpies are omnivorous. If they are able to catch live prey, they prefer to drown it first.
Familiar.Name: Swamphaunt Kelpie

Familiar.FlavourText: While this creation has an impressive stench, it is no more capable of surviving hot tar than other animals. It gets its name from the thick black mucus it produces.
Familiar.Name: Tar-Trooper Slarg

Familiar.FlavourText: The softest fren.
Familiar.Name: Sweetpuff

Familiar.FlavourText: Lumen no longer require food, drawing all the energy they need from sunlight.
Familiar.Name: Swift Lumen

Familiar.FlavourText: These fluffy creatures give static electricity a whole new level of dread.
Familiar.Name: Swift Volt

Familiar.FlavourText: It is usually uncommon to see Centaur beastclans inhabit caves.
Familiar.Name: Swiftfoot Slayer

Familiar.FlavourText: These imposing zombie-vultures can spend weeks perched in the same spot, waiting for sickly creatures to succumb.
Familiar.Name: Tatterwing Carcass

Familiar.FlavourText: Tengu will attempt to confuse and lead the unwary dragon astray.
Familiar.Name: Tengu

Familiar.FlavourText: Sent by their clans to seek and bring home their fallen flock lost to madness and confusion, these dusk-traveling bounty hunters seem to be losing their own battle with darkness.
Familiar.Name: Tengu Caller

Familiar.FlavourText: The Thunderstomp uses its great horn as a lightning rod, absorbing minor bolts of electricity from passing storms. This charged energy can then be expelled while the rhino is attacking its adversaries.
Familiar.Name: Thunderstomp

Familiar.FlavourText: Tender Larails will consume all parts of a plant except the seeds, which they carefully bury.
Familiar.Name: Tender Larail

Familiar.FlavourText: These creatures are in tune with the emotions of their school. They are quick to swarm when agitated.
Familiar.Name: Tendril Loach

Familiar.FlavourText: There's something questionable about this bear...
Familiar.Name: Thornthick Thief

Familiar.FlavourText: Guardian of the Viridian Labyrinth. (Greenskeeper Gathering 2015.)
Familiar.Name: Timber Tender

Familiar.FlavourText: No one is entirely sure what these creatures sound like. (KS-Sponsored by Lune)
Familiar.Name: Tourmaline Vulstal

Familiar.FlavourText: It's chomp o'clock.
Familiar.Name: Tick-Tock

Familiar.FlavourText: There's a lesson somewhere in here about procrastination...
Familiar.Name: Time Devourer

Familiar.FlavourText: Those who say all that treasure will never keep you company are probably feelin' pretty silly right about now. It's you and your money, goin' it alone!
Familiar.Name: Transmuted Treasure

Familiar.FlavourText: Known to sit as still as a statue when they lay in wait, these sentries are capable of leaping into sudden and violent motion.
Familiar.Name: Tigerblood Foo

Familiar.FlavourText: When sending messages oversea, a tradewinds gull is the bird of choice.
Familiar.Name: Tradewinds Gull

Familiar.FlavourText: Be careful where you plant those rare flowers, or you may find they'll get away from you.
Familiar.Name: Travelling Garden

Familiar.FlavourText: Did you see that? It looked like a fox! You didn't? Well, it was there a second ago...
Familiar.Name: Trick of the Light

Familiar.FlavourText: That groundquake isn't an erupting volcano. Steer clear of the vents if you don't want to play an unpleasant game of whack-a-head.
Familiar.Name: Tunnel Hydra

Familiar.FlavourText: Dwarf Hainu come in many shapes, sizes, colors, and volumes. This one happens to be the loudest! (Colored by vulpines.)
Familiar.Name: Tricolor Yapper

Familiar.FlavourText: A dragon that has closely bonded with its firebug may be able to use its sight for short periods of time. It's a pity its vision is terrible.
Familiar.Name: Triple-Sight Firebug

Familiar.FlavourText: A swarm of these beetles can devour a field overnight.
Familiar.Name: Tufted Leaf Beetle

Familiar.FlavourText: This tropical caiman is mostly found basking in tidepools near the sea. (Colored by Parda.)
Familiar.Name: Tropical Caiman

Familiar.FlavourText: The most formal Floracat. (Colored by slothbug.)
Familiar.Name: Tuxedo Floracat

Familiar.FlavourText: Yes, you can have it all.
Familiar.Name: Ultimate Buttersnake

Familiar.FlavourText: An orbiting collection of opposing elements. Each clash emits a dangerous wave of unstable energy.
Familiar.Name: Unlikely Alliance

Familiar.FlavourText: It is said that this dashing cape is imbued with the magical essence of a long-dead hero of renowned bravery.
Familiar.Name: Valorous Cape

Familiar.FlavourText: When a skin is shed this serpent is at its most vulnerable; it loses its feathers as well.
Familiar.Name: Ultramel Amphithere

Familiar.FlavourText: Quite an upgrade from the Ram and Superram. Credit where credit is due.
Familiar.Name: Ultraram

Familiar.FlavourText: Solitary creatures by nature, only one Qiriq may live in a forest. They are not shy about using lethal force to enforce this claim.
Familiar.Name: Umberhorn Qiriq

Familiar.FlavourText: Umbra wolves are adept at blending into the shadows. The unwary dragon may find itself surrounded by a pack it never saw coming.
Familiar.Name: Umbra Wolf

Familiar.FlavourText: A domestication effort gone awry, this totally-not-tamed-at-all Rambra is out for vengeance. Steer clear!
Familiar.Name: Unburdened Billy

Familiar.FlavourText: Magic is required to slay an undying featherback and put it to rest.
Familiar.Name: Undying Featherback

Familiar.FlavourText: The stone armor accumulates over time reflecting the creature's habitat. (KS-Sponsored by Tumblebuck.)
Familiar.Name: Venerable Shalebuck

Familiar.FlavourText: It is often far too late when one notices a Venomblade Assassin in their midst. If you're really lucky, a heap of treasure might turn into a mercenary partnership.
Familiar.Name: Venomblade Assassin

Familiar.FlavourText: The venom of a Toridae can be dangerous to Fae, but larger dragon breeds are able to shrug off the effects.
Familiar.Name: Venomous Toridae

Familiar.FlavourText: A friend to this pilco has no need to fear its toothy grin.
Familiar.Name: Venomtooth Pilco

Familiar.FlavourText: These brightly-clad amphibians have become adept at prying open mollusk shells.
Familiar.Name: Vivid Wavehopper

Familiar.FlavourText: The harpy beastclan often treats these spirits as natural allies, preferring to use their resemblance to scare away enemies.
Familiar.Name: Veiled Vision

Familiar.FlavourText: Though its fur is plush, it is the soft down of the leaves that earned this floracat's name. (Colored by Skelizard.)
Familiar.Name: Velvet Floracat

Familiar.FlavourText: It's rumored that special epiptites can talk and grant wishes! You just have to speak to enough of them to find one...
Familiar.Name: Vermillion Epiptite

Familiar.FlavourText: The mith are known for their pragmatic speaking style, and will happily hold conversation with you...as long as there isn't a lightbulb on nearby. (Thundercrack Carnivale 2018 Holiday Item)
Familiar.Name: Voltaic Ambassador

Familiar.FlavourText: Entourage of the Tidelord. (Wavecrest Saturnalia Holiday Familiar 2014.)
Familiar.Name: Water Sprite

Familiar.FlavourText: There's something 'not right' about this bear...
Familiar.Name: Voltspire Intruder

Familiar.FlavourText: It made for a really nice mealtime instrument until that one year where a bright purple ghost fox came pouring out instead of gravy.
Familiar.Name: Vulpine Lamp

Familiar.FlavourText: These scavengers return to a Golden Idol with the trinkets they were able to collect.
Familiar.Name: Wasteland Collector

Familiar.FlavourText: Many have wondered when this tengu will finally wander home.
Familiar.Name: Wandering Surgepriest

Familiar.FlavourText: This warcat is larger than average, and is capable of bearing the the weight of reinforced plate armor with ease.
Familiar.Name: Warcat Protector

Familiar.FlavourText: Elder wartoads rival guardian dragons in size.
Familiar.Name: Wartoad

Familiar.FlavourText: Patrolling the shallows, it sweeps all who would challenge it aside.
Familiar.Name: Wave Sweeper

Familiar.FlavourText: Companies of sorcerers working in tandem have been attempting to unravel stray bubbles from The Tidelord's prophecies. Entire schools have gone mad for their efforts.
Familiar.Name: Waveswell Sorcerer

Familiar.FlavourText: It's the biggest, and that makes it the best! (It's kind of a jerk about it though.)
Familiar.Name: Webwing Alpha

Familiar.FlavourText: A lone wendigo is a danger to both beastclans and dragonkind.
Familiar.Name: Wendigo

Familiar.FlavourText: The long legs of this unicorn allow it to walk along the bottom of shallow swamp beds, enabling it to easily graze on the aquatic plantlife.
Familiar.Name: Wetland Unicorn

Familiar.FlavourText: After a season, wood ear deer enter a second stage of life. This veteran is an even more effective guardian.
Familiar.Name: White Rot Deer

Familiar.FlavourText: Guardian of the Sea of a Thousand Currents. (Wavecrest Saturnalia 2015.)
Familiar.Name: Wavebreak Snarler

Familiar.FlavourText: Named for the plants that it keeps free of insects, watermelon coleus are a boon to any garden. (Colored by KCDragons.)
Familiar.Name: Watermelon Coleus Gecko

Familiar.FlavourText: Entourage of the Windsinger. (Mistral Jamboree Holiday Familiar 2014.)
Familiar.Name: Wind Sprite

Familiar.FlavourText: This owl's bite is worse than its bark.
Familiar.Name: Wildwood Owl

Familiar.FlavourText: Some harpies prefer solitude to participation in the hierarchy of their warrior society.
Familiar.Name: Windcarve Fugitive

Familiar.FlavourText: Agility and adaptability are a requirement for a harpy courier.
Familiar.Name: Windcarve Harpy

Familiar.FlavourText: These hardy canines grow incredibly large. Packs of winter wolves run in throughout the Boreal Wood. While not the dominant predator, they are the most numerous.
Familiar.Name: Winter Wolf

Familiar.FlavourText: A good eye and a steady hand are required to shoot while galloping.
Familiar.Name: Wintermane Bowman

Familiar.FlavourText: The wintermane clan is not named for their snow-white mane and tail, but for the leader of their herd.
Familiar.Name: Wintermane Spearman

Familiar.FlavourText: In addition to their trusty instruments, these performative centaurs use their voices and a rhythmic tapping of their hooves to spin songs and tell tales.
Familiar.Name: Wintermane Minstrel

Familiar.FlavourText: This creature has little in common with its mammalian namesake. Wood ear deer are cultivated to protect dryads' secluded groves.
Familiar.Name: Wood Ear Deer

Familiar.FlavourText: Rather reclusive, this fowl is seen only once a year.
Familiar.Name: Woodland Turkey

Familiar.FlavourText: The chilling howl of these phantom dogs can be heard for miles.
Familiar.Name: Wraith Hound

Familiar.FlavourText: Flocks of sparrowmice can frequently be heard rustling in the walls of poorly constructed lairs.
Familiar.Name: Yellow-Throated Sparrowmouse

Familiar.FlavourText: Flocks of Zalis light up a jungle canopy.
Familiar.Name: Zalis

Familiar.FlavourText: When you can see the patterning on this yeti, you are far too close to come out unscathed. (Colored by Accents.)
Familiar.Name: Yeti Brawler

Familiar.FlavourText: Only shadow dragons can see wispwillow perytons after night falls. To others, they appear as a jumble of small floating specks of light. (Colored by Xemni.)
Familiar.Name: Wispwillow Peryton

Familiar.FlavourText: This enchanted puppet moves when you don't want it to, and hangs limp when you'd like it to dance.
Familiar.Name: Wooden Marionette

Familiar.FlavourText: During the winter months, Zeebas grow a long, thick, woolen coat. This coat has no stripes, and the Zeeba's striking coloring is obscured until late spring.
Familiar.Name: Zeeba

Familiar.FlavourText: Knows nothing about nothing.
Familiar.Name: Terra Tortoise

Familiar.FlavourText: The eyes of the Tidelord. (Wavecrest Saturnalia Holiday Familiar 2017.)
Familiar.Name: Bubbling Goblin

Familiar.FlavourText: 10x more awesome than a regular hyena.
Familiar.Name: Dire Hyena

Familiar.FlavourText: Dragons who choose to bond gold-throated sparrows as familiars often have a difficult time keeping them out of the bellies of their clan-mates.
Familiar.Name: Gold-Throated Sparrow
